'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:56:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Could we see tests ?"}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-08-05 10:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure thing. But before doing this, I need to commit the test branch first, due to dependencies in https://review.openstack.org/40201'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-05 17:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

In heat::engine, where are all rabbit/qpid parameters coming from?'}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-08-05 17:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Are coming from init.pp . I just added the qpid variables support to a previously configured rabbitmq. You think we need to put those in engine.pp ?'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Parameters must not be referred to or used as global variables. Each classes should define all parameters they need or not depend on an other class parameters.

I don't know/use heat. However from the point of view of a puppet module author, I feel the module needs improvement in that aspect. Which classes require rabbit parameters and which don't?"}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-08-06 07:31:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I understand what you mean. Completely. I am a newbie on the puppet world so I'm really flexible in order to understand correctly what's the right approach.

The modules that require rabbit are: api-cloudwatch.pp, engine.pp, init.pp, api-cfn.pp, api.pp

(Btw, I noticed that I forgot to add the other files in the commit, sigh.)

Anyway, I'm not the main author of this module, because it's Emilien Macchi, I'm just contributing as much as possible :)"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-08 02:48:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-08 02:49:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-08-08 10:12:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

It's abandoned. Got updated and fixed on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40714/"}]

Added support for QPID rpc

This patch allow to heat to take advantage of the Qpid queue system

Signed-off-by: Francesco Vollero <fvollero@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix an error of converting exceptions to str

Convert Message object returned by lazy gettext to str
in OpenstackException.__str__ method.

Fixes bug #1209484

Change-Id: I29338c03562daf17230178a6b3e83da746588c86

commit_message:
Provide a way to clean up testing database

We will need to clean up stacks(hard delete) sometimes in the tests.
Resoure, ResourceData, and Event need to be cleaned up as well because
of the integrity constraints.

blueprint event-persistence

Change-Id: I355f7a9909eb3ad3febca62fdb57ecbaab73f2ce

commit_message:
Skip more security group tests until bug 1182384 is fixed

This patch builds on change I3f0d21c23661f556354c321476ba559d4925dccd
which skipped a couple of tests that are failing in nova if neutron is
configured. The previous patch missed a couple of other tests that fail
for the same bug. This patch skips those other failing tests for the
same bug.

Related-Bug: #1182384

Change-Id: I4f191f21232f9e58ad09456261fb6247d64f22b5

commit_message:
Add test for swift ACLs

This test case set some read and write ACLs and
erify that objects are or not available to another
user.

Change-Id: I6e89d8478b18406dec3e87886eee6dc0d72f9209
Implements: bp test-swift-acls

commit_message:
Adds tests covering Swift's Account Quota middleware

The execution of the tests is conditional to a setting declared
in the config file.

There are 2 tests:
 + User uploads an object smaller than the quota successfully
 + User fails to upload an object larger than the quota

Note that this test assumes that the admin account has the
ResellerAdmin role.

Change-Id: I00dd1b88d4d9b65b4c6f5b9cc6b1c8704bdc9d8b

commit_message:
Fix Instance objects with empty security groups

This makes sure that a DB instance with an empty list of security
groups does not result in an object with an unset attribute, thus
triggering a lazy load on access (and ultimately an exception).

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ib33b05853e9d067cbac5d3e87824a68e9935b822

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

So great in principle.  Problem is that this is changing the DB schema, which we want (unless a critical issue) to avoid after the m2 Havana cut-off (which we have already passed).  So I think this change is good for IceHouse, but not sure the problem is bad enough to warrant inclusion now.

As an aside, you will need an SQL migration function to go with this to allow migration (from and to) an existing DB.'}, {'account_id': 6781, 'date': '2013-07-31 19:02:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@henry-nash
But adding orm.relationship to a table does not change DB schema, isn't it?.. All the ForeignKey and Column constructs are left untouched. Saying that, I think this change may be merged with trunk, because it does not introduce any changes to DB schema."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-08-02 11:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ahh, sorry, I should have looked a bit closer.  So, for all DB types, is the sql.relationship orm addition purely a "runtime SQL generation modifier" and does not change the DB definition?  (just want to make sure that a customer that migrates their DB from earlier version ends up with the same DB structure as a newly minted DB)'}, {'account_id': 6781, 'date': '2013-08-02 17:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@henry-nash

Exactly, sqlalchemy.orm.relationship is a runtime-only addition which does not touch DB schema. I've written a very simple and naive test to prove that adding orm.relationship works with original DB schema: http://pastebin.com/AbkC8Ysi. There's also another gerrit review which adds orm.relationship to neutron's port_security table (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37324/) without adding DB migration files."}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-08-05 06:47:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

OK, sounds good.  I'd suggest we had to the commit comment to clarify this fact - this will ensure other reviews don't fall into the same trap I did."}, {'account_id': 6781, 'date': '2013-08-05 21:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 22:49:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Fix select n+1 issue in keystone catalog

keystone.catalog.backends.sql.get_catalog() and get_v3_catalog() methods
generate N+1 select statements for each endpoint. Use sqlalchemy's
eager load to generate single select statement instead of generating N+1
select statents for each endpoint.

Given change does not modify DB schema and is runtime-only, since it's a
one-to-many relationship.

Change-Id: Ia72b8603fc13f01696771f6116b320364bd50f51
Fixes: bug #1206725

owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Puppet Forge 2.1.1 Release

Prior to this commit, the Modulefile incorrectly listed the
puppet-quantum module version as 0.2.2. This patch updates
the version to 2.1.1. As the repository has already been
given a release tag of 2.1.0, this is a candidate for a new
release with a minor bug fix version bump. No 2.1.0 module
will be available.

Change-Id: Id94800e318e4560b6ba5555f43f849d8df028f5a

commit_message:
Add test for migrations.

This test checks that models are synced with migrations:
- tables column
  (name, type, length, default value, index and unique attributes),
- indexes,
- foreign keys,
- unique keys (naming convention, columns order).

This test work only for mysql and psql dialect.
For using this check user `openstack_citest` with password
`openstack_citest` should be created. For checking database
`openstack_citest` will use.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I02cac0b18540a1e1799143ec510f0cbcb8583e3f

modified vxlan type driver for kernel vxlan support

 * add an implementation option to guide agents which implementation to use
 * pass multicast group to agents
 * remove udp port setting in endpoint, because multicast requires all
      endpoints share the same udp port

Change-Id: I195cb889b2509ca29b31e5188f83cb44966db633
Implements: blueprint openvswitch-kernel-vxlan
'}]
commit_message:
kernel vxlan TypeDriver (WIP)

modified vxlan type driver for kernel vxlan support

 * add an implementation option to guide agents which implementation to use
 * pass multicast group to agents
 * remove udp port setting in endpoint, because multicast requires all
      endpoints share the same udp port

Change-Id: I195cb889b2509ca29b31e5188f83cb44966db633
Implements: blueprint openvswitch-kernel-vxlan

commit_message:
Fix Incorrect HTTP response while creating flavor without name

When creating a new flavor if name key is not specified in JSON request
body, it returns status error response as 500. Ideally it should return a
badRequest(400) as status response.
Fixes bug#1202690

Change-Id: I71f840f588983b2ce4379ae6172fa5527a3253ac

commit_message:
Update openstack.common.config

- Add generator.py from Oslo
- Add notifier from Oslo
- Add generator bash script used by other
projects to generate configuration files
- Update openstack-common.conf file

Update also Oslo modules

Fix bug #1206650

Change-Id: I4eeae905d9a36164f6db2e804219e89367111283

(8 inline comments)

The main reason of -1 is try/catch of ip_lib _execute. It affects many places and must break the other programs (they expects an exception is raised on error).

I prefer bridge_lib rather than lb_lib. "lb" has several meanings. In quantum both "linux bridge" and "load balancer" are abbreviated to "lb".

In addition, unit tests for lb_lib needs to be added. Now tests for linux bridge agent covers lb_lib, but we should have a separate test for lb_lib. In unit tests for linux bridge agent, lb_lib methods should be mocked.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(23 inline comments)

First we need to apologize you that we could not spend enough time on this patch. I hope you understand core team has been busy to cope with high priority items.

Please find my feedback in inline comments.

Regarding the unit test of lb agent, mocking bridge_lib is better in general from the point view of the unit test of linux bridge agent.
Perhaps you would like to ensure the agent behavior is unchanged, so it is reasonable to me. Next, we need to consider how to separate the unit tests of lb agent and bridge_lib and to remove "ip command" level check from this file.

Thanks,
Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 1267, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add bridge_lib.py to wrap brctl calls in LinuxBridge Agent

Added bridge_lib with tests
Changed linuxbridge_quantum_agent to use bridge_lib and ip_lib

Implements: blueprint linuxbridge-quantum-agent-iplib
Change-Id: I13ac3339f1bbc57d150b4e4db95a903886f6bbcd

commit_message:
Add support for translating API error responses

Using the Message class from oslo gettextutils,
we can now translate exception/error messages that
come from the API into a native locale selected from
the HTTP Accept-Language header we get from client
requests.

implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I35fe6365f878d1bc2f5798fca40edf29c9495594

The client did not check if the keystone endpoint was https to change the port from 80 to 443.
This fix checks if the scheme = https and, if so, changes the port to 443

Fixes: bug #1205317
Change-Id: I1b264db8e62d4acbf6129e4608397c4a90d1ecb0
'}, {'created': '2013-07-30 08:07:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix port bug with https access

The client did not check if the keystone endpoint was https to change the port from 80 to 443.
This fix checks if the scheme = https and, if so, changes the port to 443

Fixes: bug #1205317
Change-Id: I1b264db8e62d4acbf6129e4608397c4a90d1ecb0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix port bug with https access

The client did not check if the keystone endpoint was https to change the port from 80 to 443.
This fix checks if the scheme = https and, if so, changes the port to 443

Fixes: bug #1205317
Change-Id: I1b264db8e62d4acbf6129e4608397c4a90d1ecb0

'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-06-21 13:38:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark, I've been doing a little work around wsgi.py recently so just a thought here:

Could this change lead to subtle bugs been introduced that are not caught now due to the tests using a different default hub(selects) to the actual glance code(poll)?

I noticed swift contains a get_hub function (https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/utils.py#L865), which tries poll and falls back to selects when not available.  Could this potentially be added to oslo and then used here as well?

I'd be happy to help out with that if you feel it makes sense.  Otherwise please ignore :)"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-06-21 17:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Paul,

I share your concerns. However, I think the fact that the default testing behavior is using workers == 0 basically makes the choice of hub unimportant. Also, if selects and poll hubs are different enough to affect us, that feels like an eventlet testing issue, not a glance one. So I imagine it would be caught in our tempest tests, or otherwise managed outside of glance. Just in order to keep the universe sane, I think we really have to treat eventlet hubs as substitutable for correctness purposes.

It is possible that I could keep "poll" as the default for most tests, and just use "selects" for the multiprocessing test, though. . .

Regarding oslo, I think it could make sense, but I don't want to block on oslo in order to get the multiprocessing tests working. Also, common wsgi behavior comes pretty close to the common wsgi framework, which has been a pretty quick route to yak-shaving in my experience. YMMV :-)

Thanks again!'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Appreciate the response and elaboration Mark, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-07-03 13:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-06-19 21:38:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix test_multiprocessing.py for OS X and BSD

OS X / BSD use more basic ps syntax and do not support the eventlet
'poll' hub. Since the performance difference is not noticeable for our
testing purposes, we can make the default hub 'selects' for testing.

Fixes bug #1020739

Change-Id: I3dc4a9fc5247a8575a1522bbf586a17ac22c2ef4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_multiprocessing.py for OS X and BSD

OS X / BSD use more basic ps syntax and do not support the eventlet
'poll' hub. Since the performance difference is not noticeable for our
testing purposes, we can make the default hub 'selects' for testing.

Fixes bug #1020739

Change-Id: I3dc4a9fc5247a8575a1522bbf586a17ac22c2ef4

commit_message:
Change decorator to webob as doesn't need to be wsgi

This patch changes the decorates in the metadata agents to webob.Request
as they don't need to go through wsgi. Note: wsgi.Request's base class
is webob.Request.

Fixes bug: 1208907

Change-Id: I069635eb67812136d314fc260cebf65886a95597

Gary, this is just moving/unifying existing code. It was done at the database layer a while back for several reasons, including:

Code that turned an instance object into a dict ended up with real IPaddress objects, requiring the DB layer to filter anyway. MySQL would be fine with this because it would string-coerce those and get a reasonable result. Postgres would fail because it didn't recognize the stronger type."}, {'account_id': 7069, 'date': '2013-08-05 13:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Pull out instance object handling for use by create also

The instance_create() function needs the same type handling
logic to tolerate object-initiated creates as does instance_update().
This pulls that logic out to a common function and makes both of
them use it.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ie8612ffb225b95bf7eab3c462441665095ed19bc

commit_message:
Make fake_instance handle security groups

This makes the fake_db_instance() helper create model-like security
group objects in the returned instance if a list of names is
specified. This is required to test anything that uses security
groups on the instance.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I4a7d91c939af8c0dc4e0b3e29c477a859d85fd3e

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-07-26 14:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This looks much better, but IMHO we're not taking full advantage of the conversion into a stack resource, I was expecting the resize to happen as a stack update (we need https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/nested-stack-updates which should be a simple change)

The advantage of doing this is we get to leverage the existing stack update mechanism, so on resize we'd just need to do e.g:

self.update(self._create_template(num_instances))

Then the resize really just becomes a template generation exercise, e.g we create an instance resource snippet with the specified LaunchConfiguration, then do something like:

resource_snippet = {"instance%s" %i : instance_snippet for i in range(num_inst)}

Or some variation thereof which works on python 2.6'}, {'account_id': 6800, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6800, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

Still working on this. main thing left is to destroy after instance creation failure.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:07:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Refactor InstanceGroup to use a nested stack

Much of the code of InstanceGroup was able to be deleted in
preference for using the native functionality of StackResource.
InstanceGroup now generates a template and updates the nested
stack when it needs to be created or resized.

blueprint instance-group-nested-stack

Fixes bug 1189278

Change-Id: Ic08a55cad1ac34d69080c0ef2dae4877f1fefd29

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-05 22:36:37.000000000', 'message': "Ensure http_connect is mocked out in tests

Otherwise this test will try to connect to several addresses that aren't
mapped. On Linux the entier 127.0.0.* block is mapped to localhost, so this
often isn't noticed, but on OS X only 127.0.0.1 is mapped by default.

Change-Id: I44034d5006ff25e052afdb6599ab5838e4c5ae5b
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure http_connect is mocked out in tests

Otherwise this test will try to connect to several addresses that aren't
mapped. On Linux the entier 127.0.0.* block is mapped to localhost, so this
often isn't noticed, but on OS X only 127.0.0.1 is mapped by default.

Change-Id: I44034d5006ff25e052afdb6599ab5838e4c5ae5b

commit_message:
Remove duplicate image tests for tenant authZ

* Remove 'test_delete_image_of_another_tenant' which duplicates
test_delete_image_for_alt_account in authorization tests
* Remove 'test_create_image_for_server_in_another_tenant' which duplicates
test_create_image_for_alt_account_fails in authorization tests

Fixes bug #1130462
Change-Id: I18a1a5345f21ec4d055ae5c0dcae858feaf143c8

income requests.

Raise jsonschema requirement to >=1.3.0,!=1.4.0.

See bug #1202391 for details.

Change-Id: I3b8054b25f2b3d9ed0c3dd1be320f7402ceb9635
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>"}]
commit_message:
Raise jsonschema requirement

Glance PATCH API need use new 'require' condition for schema to validate
income requests.

Raise jsonschema requirement to >=1.3.0,!=1.4.0.

See bug #1202391 for details.

Change-Id: I3b8054b25f2b3d9ed0c3dd1be320f7402ceb9635
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

[{'created': '2013-08-04 08:55:51.000000000', 'message': 'remove improper usage of 'assert'

The assert will not raise AssertionError when run Python with '-O' flag.
And at the same time, any program should have a same result with or
without '-O' flag. So we could use assert to check some rare condition,
but we couldn't use it in logic flow, for example:

this is not bad:
def func(fname):
    assert os.path.exist(fname)
    f = open(fname)
    ...

but this will have different results with or without '-O' flag
def func(num):
    try:
        assert num is 5
    except: Assertionerror:
        log.error("your number isn't 5!")

The second case is what I fixes in this patch.

Change-Id: I20e83ecfc181d213f357aa74e0af3a110526904c

    f = open(fname)

commit_message:
remove improper usage of 'assert'

The assert will not raise AssertionError when run Python with '-O' flag.
And at the same time, any program should have a same result with or
without '-O' flag. So we could use assert to check some rare condition,
but we couldn't use it in logic flow or except it must raise an
Assertionerror, for example:

this is not bad:

def func(fname):
    assert os.path.exist(fname)
    f = open(fname)
    ...

but this will have different results with or without '-O' flag

def func(num):
    try:
        assert num is 5
    except: Assertionerror:
        log.error("your number isn't 5!")

The second case is what I fixes in this patch.

fixes bug #1199354
Change-Id: I20e83ecfc181d213f357aa74e0af3a110526904c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-03 20:41:28.000000000', 'message': 'Raise 402 when instance not found in admin_actions API

The pause/unpause/suspend/resume/reset_network admin action APIs do not
handle the case where the instance in the request is not found and they
raise HTTPUnprocessableEntity (code 422) instead. There are several
other operations in the same API which handle the 402 case and translate
it correctly, this patch cleans up the rest.

Closes-Bug: #1204999

Change-Id: If54d6be99db55b4f99da11fe75c14bf21685e809
'}, {'created': '2013-08-03 21:09:54.000000000', 'message': 'Raise 404 when instance not found in admin_actions API

The pause/unpause/suspend/resume/reset_network admin action APIs do not
handle the case where the instance in the request is not found and they
raise HTTPUnprocessableEntity (code 422) instead. There are several
other operations in the same API which handle the 404 case and translate
it correctly, this patch cleans up the rest.

Closes-Bug: #1204999

Change-Id: If54d6be99db55b4f99da11fe75c14bf21685e809
'}]
commit_message:
Raise 404 when instance not found in admin_actions API

The pause/unpause/suspend/resume/reset_network admin action APIs do not
handle the case where the instance in the request is not found and they
raise HTTPUnprocessableEntity (code 422) instead. There are several
other operations in the same API which handle the 404 case and translate
it correctly, this patch cleans up the rest.

Closes-Bug: #1204999

Change-Id: If54d6be99db55b4f99da11fe75c14bf21685e809

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-08-05 11:02:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Not sure we have the setting correct here.

I would probably just hardcode there to be a glance and bittorrent downloader, and use the existing settings to help choose when each should be used.

We could make it easier to plug in new downloaders, but we should probably have a list of them, each with an image key that will select it, and a setting that says which one of the keys is the default, should there be no image hint. Right now that feels like overkill."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-08-05 21:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (5 inline comments)

commit_message:
xenapi: Adding BitTorrent download handler

Part of series of patches which extends uploadhandler driver-pattern to also
handle downloads.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic5445167bb425c9ba910039db182783a2f1defdd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 15:43:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the user monkey patching is done for the API tests

When running a subset of the tests, the get_user middleware monkey
patching in openstack_auth.utils did not always happen, causing some
of the tests to fail due to missing expected properties.

Fixes bug #1209177

Change-Id: Ic00b842e740954b0f36353381f511f7ba3eab70b
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the user monkey patching is done for the API tests

When running a subset of the tests, the get_user middleware monkey
patching in openstack_auth.utils did not always happen, causing some
of the tests to fail due to missing expected properties.

Fixes bug #1209177

Change-Id: Ic00b842e740954b0f36353381f511f7ba3eab70b

commit_message:
Updates Topology to correctly handle resources in the INIT state.

Before resources are pushed to create_in_progress,
they now exist as init_complete.
This allows us to draw the entire topology at
instantiation instead of waiting for
resources to start creating before they can be seen
in the topology.

Change-Id: I9c5ea164ec13f1b89633c4b10c04e0c1941649b7
Implements: blueprint init-state-heat-topology

commit_message:
Implement an "Action in progress" error.

Raises an "Action in progress" error if an action is in progress when
another action is issued.

Fixes bug #1207032

Change-Id: I2b6fd92cfa4b93ac2531dd3d76bf2dfc01e58c50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 15:18:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix instance actions testing

Somehow, the instance actions API was different in three places:

1. The actual API from a running system
2. The regular unit tests
3. The api_samples tests

This fixes the fake_instance_actions module to look like the database
model (which was the root of the problem) as well as the api_samples
and regular unit tests to properly confirm the actual behavior I
validated manually against a running system. This looks like it
changes the external API, but in fact, it makes things match what
the external API actually is.

Change-Id: I0c8ddff3e0819a65667617083dfaa74f7317cc05
'}]
commit_message:
Fix instance actions testing

Somehow, the instance actions API was different in three places:

1. The actual API from a running system
2. The regular unit tests
3. The api_samples tests

This fixes the fake_instance_actions module to look like the database
model (which was the root of the problem) as well as the api_samples
and regular unit tests to properly confirm the actual behavior I
validated manually against a running system. This looks like it
changes the external API, but in fact, it makes things match what
the external API actually is.

Change-Id: I0c8ddff3e0819a65667617083dfaa74f7317cc05

commit_message:
Add missing copyright license headers

We're working on adding enforcement that things have appropriate
copyright license headers. In anticipation of that, fix the files that don't
have them.

Change-Id: Ie0a9fd5eece5b6671ff4389b07b69ca29be7d017

commit_message:
Enable localizable REST API responses via the Accept-Language header

Add support for doing language resolution for a request, based on the
Accept-Language HTTP header. Using the lazy gettext functionality, from
oslo gettextutils, it is possible to use the resolved language to
translate exception messages to the user requested language and
return that translation from the API.

Partially implements bp user-locale-api.

Change-Id: I63edc8463836bfff257daa8a2c66ed5d3a444254

commit_message:
Assignment to reserved built-in symbol

Built-in symbol: file, format, range etc was re-assigned as local vars
in files: test/functional/swift_test_client.py and
test/functional/tests.py, rename these local vars.

Fixes bug #1208078

Change-Id: I627894cd722bd32cad231d534cbe97a0412c7cc9

  >=1.0.0 <2.0.0

commit_message:
Do not restrict flavor to only ID and integers

- Flavors with strings and not just ID/UUID strings are valid.
- Closes-Bug: 1209060

Change-Id: Idee389fce40f8982b263e1a4349a8565140b6584

Updates the port_tracker code to use the sqlalchemy merge method
instead of the add method for the port location tracking code to
avoid primary key constraint errors if port-ids are ever re-used

Fixes: bug #1208990
Change-Id: I06065ac888873b00f445d4356b17f084ee38c1ea
'}, {'created': '2013-08-07 01:21:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix BigSwitch plugin to handle device_id re-use in porttracker code

Updates the BigSwitch port_tracker code to use the sqlalchemy merge method
instead of the add method for the port location tracking code to avoid primary
 key constraint errors if device-ids are moved or re-used

Fixes: bug #1208990
Change-Id: I06065ac888873b00f445d4356b17f084ee38c1ea
'}]
commit_message:
Fix BigSwitch plugin to handle device_id re-use in porttracker code

Updates the BigSwitch port_tracker code to use the sqlalchemy merge method
instead of the add method for the port location tracking code to avoid primary
 key constraint errors if device-ids are moved or re-used

Fixes: bug #1208990
Change-Id: I06065ac888873b00f445d4356b17f084ee38c1ea

AndCheck() and OrCheck() classes in common policy module missing a argument
when calls rules in __call__() method.
Current patch fixed it by adding the necessary argument. Tests added.

Fixed bug 1194354

Change-Id: I9a6e7d04b06ef61216cb7dbfd291c855b799b621
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing argument bug in oslo common policy

AndCheck() and OrCheck() classes in common policy module missing a argument
when calls rules in __call__() method.
Current patch fixed it by adding the necessary argument. Tests added.

Fixed bug 1194354

Change-Id: I9a6e7d04b06ef61216cb7dbfd291c855b799b621

Might be cleaner?'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-08-02 06:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Agree with Sandy, I think - if the issue is with logging, let's mask obfuscate the URL in the logs

I guess the other examples of this are the Opt(secret=True) flag in oslo.config and safe_log() in rpc"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-08-02 08:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

So I can see the auth_token and passwords are sanitized in openstack.common.rpc.common before logging. This is possible because there is a particular piece of code that processes these rpc messages. But the db url of CONF.database.connection is set directly in oslo.cfg.CONF so it could be printed out anywhere in the code.

So what you guys are suggesting is that we should provide something like _safe_dburl_log() and restrict direct logging of CONF.database.connection by discreet reviewing and patches upon bug reports?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-02 08:42:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Helper function to sanitize db url credentials

The database url is sanitized in logfiles because of security issues.
However the connected url itself is useful information to devs and admins.
This patch provides a helper function to sanitize only the credentials
in a database url. All projects must process the CONF.database.connection
value using "sanitize_db_url" when updating the db package

Fixes bug #1076833

Change-Id: Id6cf7b120ef6c3fcda7f33fd26676b62a4475bb2

commit_message:
Move sqlalchemy migration from Nova

Added functions for work with migration scripts to
openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py file. This code can be used
in Nova, Cinder, Glance, etc. Added new DbMigrationError exception to
openstack/common/db/exception.py file.
Tests added.

blueprint test-migrations

Change-Id: Ia63f7fb89b0a6baacf3fd424c0db09c74680af4a

I don't think I've seen a response to the comments from me and lifeless, so I'm going to -2 until you at least explain the thinking here

I could buy the idea that a base class is useful for some things, but this seems like a "kitchen sink" base class

Also, this duplicates some code already in oslo-incubator - see tests/utils.py - so, the patch should at least be removing that duplication

Also, consider splitting this patch up - patches to add individual fixtures, a patch to add a bare-bones base class and then other patches to have the base class adopt individual fixtures by default'}, {'account_id': 7794, 'date': '2013-07-17 12:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 12:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-20 12:33:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

The tempfiles and config stuff both make sense as fixtures - you want the tempfiles deleted and the configuration reset by tearDown()

Also, please don't just upload new revisions of the patch without comment - explain why you think the new revision addresses reviewers' comments. This is supposed to be a conversation."}, {'account_id': 7794, 'date': '2013-07-21 17:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Mark, I've updated the BP and described what I want and why. I would be happy if you take a look to it. =)
My goal is to increase code reuse and improve quality of code. 
Every project already has (or will have) some sort of such file, so why don't extract all these common parts and land it to oslo? Separating these parts, we will have to sustain tests-related code in only one place."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-22 20:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I think I understand that the goal of Oslo is to encourage code re-use :)

The feedback we're giving is to add these features in a way that doesn't require all projects to use an "everything but the kitchen sink base class"

By designing nicely encapsulated fixtures, I think we've a better change to get sane code re-use

For example, something like this:

 class Config(fixtures.Fixture):

     def __init__(self, conf=cfg.CONF):
         self.conf = conf

     def setUp(self):
         super(Cfg, self).setUp()
         self.addCleanup(self.conf.reset)

     def config(self, **kw):
         group = kw.pop('group', None)
         for k, v in kw.iteritems():
             self.conf.set_override(k, v, group)


 def ExampleTestCase(testtools.TestCase):

     def setUp(self):
         super(ExampleTestCase, self).setUp()
         self.config = self.useFixture(Config()).config'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Abandoned

commit_message:
Use testtools.TestCase assertion methods

I typically avoided using e.g. assertIsNone() thinking we couldn't use
it on 2.7, but now that we use testtools.TestCast there are a bunch of
useful assertion methods we can use.

Change-Id: I7696dc4744cdfd2466773326f202bc08dcfcbf0f

commit_message:
Removed ceilometer references

Ceilometer has its own cookbook `openstack-metering`.  Removing
ceilo from this cookbook to ensure we focus our efforts on the
new cookbook.  I have yet to perform integration testing on
the metering cookbook, but I imagine things should be in working
order as we all begin to use it.

Change-Id: I0bc5dd3591d9686b5cf7dd7046f0b1d7436ca2fd

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-08 00:34:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is excellent work, however I do not believe that it belongs in the main networking cookbook. Rather, I think it belongs in a wrapper cookbook that sets up monitoring/graphing stuffs.

At AT&T, this would be in our infra-monitoring cookbook, and I'm sure most folks have some similar monitoring wrapper cookbook...

So, +1 on the concept and code, -1 for having it mixed into the main OpenStack Network cookbook."}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-08-08 00:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Migrating to internal cookbooks.'}]

commit_message:
Add graphite reporting for key flow metrics

We wish to graph flow counts and basic metrics as most people
aim to do with any network equipment.  Openvswitch supports
sFlow, and can be pointed at an external aggregator, but we
also want to capture some key metrics into graphite.  This
commit adds a new statistics feature to the cookbook which
remains off by default but if enabled will periodically
submit graphite statistics.  The following statistics will be
generated and sent to your graphite srerver, where o2r2
is the hostname of the l3 router:

openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.external.count 10 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.integration.count 0 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.tunnel.count 0 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.external.hits 7229270 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.external.missed 4991017 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.external.lost 573304 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.integration.hits 175782 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.integration.missed 836348 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.integration.lost 0 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.tunnel.hits 463 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.tunnel.missed 19941 1375916568
openstack.neutron.o2r2.flows.tunnel.lost 0 1375916568

Change-Id: If99d89bf2ba3042374be3f08d89bd7e30fe9b8b0

commit_message:
Fix lint failures

This commit fixes the lint failures from
the glance module.

It's pretty picky about classes being defined
anywhere (even in tests)

This commit removes the class from the tests so
that puppet-lint is happy.

Change-Id: I0257479fb450ed2fbb6876fb73fc695e4a1f7c49

I agree with moving the checks for PV, and basically defaulting to PV, the "preferred" launching method.

commit_message:
xenapi: remove pv detection

It was assumed that pygrub is there in domU, so that the RAW and unknown
disks were attached to domU and investigated with pygrub to find out if
PV could be used. This patch removes this functionality. Also some
cleanup is made around the ImageType mess.

From now RAW and unknown disks will not be investigated for PV-ness and
will boot as HVM.

Fixes bug 1196570

Change-Id: If84b93cee36938257b7ad0fa44b3b22878520506

oh and it would not be something that someone overrides.'}, {'account_id': 6268, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2013-08-07 15:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Override quantum network endpoint port

This is a workaround for nova bug LP#1206330.  We want to
allow the endpoint port to be customized, but if it is 443
we will override it since we are already overriding the scheme.

Change-Id: I4585c32a2e8599eefb1ac8770c71d1fb8e0012cd
'}]
commit_message:
Override quantum network endpoint port

This is a workaround for nova bug LP#1206330.  We want to
allow the endpoint port to be customized, but if it is 443
we will override it since we are already overriding the scheme.

Change-Id: I4585c32a2e8599eefb1ac8770c71d1fb8e0012cd

commit_message:
Fix wrong column name in db migration script of ryu plugin

Fixes bug #1209172

A column name of tunnelkeys table which db migration script of ryu
plugin creates is wrong.
This patch fixes the column name.

Change-Id: Ic3a445ea200111c0d7db93951804e7c4570420f2

commit_message:
Sync requirements for Keystone V3 Auth support.

Updating the minimum requirements for django_openstack_auth
and keystoneclient version to be able to support Keystone V3
Authentication.

Fixing the test data to use the keystoneclient accessInfo classes.

Implements blueprint login-domain-support

Change-Id: Icf00639cbf8f485f1e46010542f093b4a441aeed

Update keystone client usage

This patch updates the discarded and missed usage for keystone client
creating tenant, user and role.

"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:49:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Minor tweak and the rest seems reasonable. 

I realize this is an optional component, but I don't really like the fact that it's creating entirely new notifications from a completely different location than the rest of the nova notifications. 

The better approach, I think, would be to have a nova notification driver than takes existing notifications and translates them to this format. In the places where no such notification exists, new notifications should be added to nova. 

Then there is the packaging. If someone wants to use this format, they have to install Ceilometer. It should really be a separate middleware package."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:23:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: (1 inline comment)

thanks Sandy,

the reason i set it up separate from nova_notifier was because the hope was that with a few tweaks, this filter could be used on any project, not just nova. (it also never crossed my mind to use nova_notifier)

the filter was built similar to swift_middleware. agree that it sucks we have to pull in all of ceilometer to use this... maybe in a subsequent patch we could move both middleware to ceilometerclient similar to keystone auth_token middleware? (haven't really looked in to how to do this or if it's possible)."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-07-19 19:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

It should be wherever the source of the event is coming from, in this case ceilometer.middleware or something similar. 

The only saving grace is it requires an explicit install by an operator, but we could easily get into the situation where people are adding new notifications to this middleware instead of nova, where they belong. 

Breaks DRY and potentially causes confusion about what's authoritative."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 15:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/28/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3599 : SUCCESS in 1m 58s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/13/36213/28/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2403/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 12s
- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/28/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3524 : SUCCESS in 27m 52s
- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/28/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3526 : SUCCESS in 6m 45s
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-24 13:21:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Is it necessary to generate full CADF data in the notification? It would be less work in the API server if that conversion was done in the notification collector, or in the consumer of the samples (after querying the API). It would also mean those notification messages (and samples) could be used by someone that isn't working with CADF."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-25 05:22:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28: (5 inline comments)

so the reason we build the event in CADF right away is because eventually we'll add signing and other features. building the event in CADF format after the fact i believe breaks regulatory compliance (e.g. PCI-DSS, SoX, ISO 27017, etc.)."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-25 05:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/29/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3694 : SUCCESS in 1m 47s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/13/36213/29/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/2498/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/29/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/3619 : SUCCESS in 26m 19s
- http://logs.openstack.org/13/36213/29/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3621 : SUCCESS in 6m 43s
'}, {'account_id': 7163, 'date': '2013-07-26 20:21:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-26 20:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Work In Progress

wait for cadf codebase to be moved.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-08-07 21:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Abandoned

abandoned for: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40744/'}]

[{'created': '2013-08-07 21:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Allow for quantum_uri override in nova.conf

The previous patch which inserted port into the quantum_uri
setting in nova.conf, but forced an http:// scheme does not
work... since it will generate http://<HOST>:443/ which does
not make sense. This patch allows a complete override of that
URI.

Change-Id: I1a37dd2ebc9e05badffa88f0438bcc1e94972d3a
'}, {'created': '2013-08-07 21:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'Allow for quantum_uri override in nova.conf

The previous patch which inserted port into the quantum_uri
setting in nova.conf, but forced an http:// scheme does not
work... since it will generate http://<HOST>:443/ which does
not make sense. This patch allows a complete override of that
URI.

Change-Id: I1a37dd2ebc9e05badffa88f0438bcc1e94972d3a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for quantum_uri override in nova.conf

The previous patch which inserted port into the quantum_uri
setting in nova.conf, but forced an http:// scheme does not
work... since it will generate http://<HOST>:443/ which does
not make sense. This patch allows a complete override of that
URI.

Change-Id: I1a37dd2ebc9e05badffa88f0438bcc1e94972d3a

using EMC volume driver.

commit_message:
Add get_attr for EXTED_PLURALS

FW Client CLI change (d04f3822b5b7ef8d6c918c753a6e7733bdda0344)
breaks nova unit test.
The change itself is good, but we should change nova ut before
the changing neutron client.
In this commit, we will skip the error adding get_attr
for the property.
Note, this is a temporary fix, we will revert this change
when Nova side unit test fixed

Fixes bug 1209364

Change-Id: I6b5d7e6d529e05c89ad14c09069f4651ef3a500e

[{'created': '2013-08-07 20:42:41.000000000', 'message': 'Added Memory Persistence API and Generic Datatypes

Added a generic persistence API for JobBoards,
Jobs, LogBooks, Workflows, FlowDetails, Tasks,
and TaskDetails. The currently implemented
backends are in-memory and sqlite db (by use
of sqlalchemy). Also implemented generic return
types (listed above) for the generic API.

Change-Id: I8399f59e7eeae675a4515a202f8fbbc8c64bb7f1
'}]
commit_message:
Added Memory Persistence API and Generic Datatypes

Added a generic persistence API for JobBoards,
Jobs, LogBooks, Workflows, FlowDetails, Tasks,
and TaskDetails. The currently implemented
backends are in-memory and sqlite db (by use
of sqlalchemy). Also implemented generic return
types (listed above) for the generic API.

Change-Id: I8399f59e7eeae675a4515a202f8fbbc8c64bb7f1

commit_message:
Bug # 1205425 - Add Fedora image to basic install.

Added downloading of Fedora cloud image to instructions for Glance setup
in the Yum version of the guide.

commit_message:
Refactor useful nova functions for re-use.

Refactor handy nova functions out of Instance and into a helper
module. This allows alternate compute implementations to use
this functionality without having to subclass.

Change-Id: I529e2d1324981de7336264b5c697f1944668d013

Correct NVP license header files

Note: Pointed out by Akihiro but pushed by me as I was the one who
push these files originally so I have to change the license.

Fixes bug: 1209359

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:16:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So I guess I need more explanation on how extensions would work with this model.  e.g. imagine the following types of extension:

1) No DB changes - easy, not relevant to this discussion
2) Adds new DB table that only it accesses - yep, I can see how that  fits in nicely
3) Adds a new field that only it accesses to an existing DB (core) DB table - again, looks good
4) Adds/changes use of DB (core) table fields that other things (i.e. outside of this extension) access.  Not sure how this works in this context (example the recent os-inherit extension or the trusts extension)?

Maybe the answer to 4) is that such I thing can't all be an extension - you would have to split it up into a core piece and an extension piece?

I just need some clarity (either here or in the BP on what the guidelines would be"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-29 16:47:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Not bad, just one inline comment.
But before this goes in, I think some sort of documentation would really be helpful for people who are adding migrations. 

Even if it's just noted in the blueprint or in the summary of this patch.

Really just looking for 2 things to be noted:
1. directory structure that would be required: i.e.: contrib.name.sql.migrate_repo.versions
2. Any additional files that would be needed, like manage.py and manage.cfg under migrate_repo. 
3. Update repository_id in new manage.cfg."}, {'account_id': 7060, 'date': '2013-07-29 18:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

It would help if I do not have to rename migration scripts tens of times during rebases waiting for my code to be approved :)'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-30 18:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-30 21:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-30 21:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-07-30 21:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Ready For Review

commit_message:
extension migrations

Allow each of the extensions to have their own
sql migration repository instead of mixing them into
the common repo.  db_sync must be called explicitly on the extension.

In the past, it was assumed that only migrations for backends backed in
sql would be run.  In practice, however, all of the migrations were run
every time.  The code has been modified to reflect this.

Adds parameter --extension to the cli for db_sync and db_version

to test out the migrations

bin/keystone-manage db_sync --extension example

will migrate to version 1 and

bin/keystone-manage db_sync --extension example 0

will migrate it back to 0

to check the version

bin/keystone-manage db_version --extension example

blueprint multiple-sql-migrate-repos

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6852d75bde6506c535fa3d74537e3c1bbd6578d8

commit_message:
Bug fix python-quantumclient installation

On ubuntu and debian, we install the latest quantum
python client using pip since the upstream package
for quantum-pythonclient is broken and has been for
some time.  This fixes the code that was supposed
to do that.

Change-Id: I84535b6a350ea8c8a35ebd0ea60cca4587972806

commit_message:
Bug fix binding to an empty api port

Do not bind to an empty port.  Specify a default port of 9696
when binding to an interface.

Change-Id: I584fa8752b23b8d7780c9eced1e4a6f07c710fb0

If running neutron firewall-policy-create it should prompt you for the options and require a name. Currently it doesn't: 


nicira@Ubuntu1204Server:~/devstack$ neutron firewall-policy-create
Created a new firewall_policy:
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field          | Value                                |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+
| audited        | False                                |
| description    |                                      |
| firewall_rules |                                      |
| id             | 3207396e-4c01-4007-b7d0-ed9bc8a4b8ec |
| name           |                                      |
| shared         | False                                |
| tenant_id      | e457b71b24304237a5de41d026f6e058     |
+----------------+--------------------------------------+"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-07-18 00:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

ditto with:  neutron  firewall-rule-create'}, {'account_id': 7708, 'date': '2013-07-18 07:41:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-07-18 18:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(this is in response to the email thread we were having on the topic of having name as a required argument for the CLI - Aaron's last email -
"Hi Sumit,

Right; create-port prompts you for the network not name. In my opinion it's nice to have the prompt. I often use this to figure out what the args are. 

Aaron
")

Hi Aaron,

It's possible to figure out the required args using "--help" option, right?

I believe the point you are making is that you would like that each of these create options have at least on mandatory option in the CLI, such that if you don't specify that mandatory argument, the CLI prompts your rather than just picking up some defaults, which you may not be what you desire, and which subsequently results in you having to delete that resource.

If so, the firewall create CLI has a "firewall_policy_id" as a required parameter.  So, that one is taken care of.

Now, as for firewall_policy and firewall_rule, I am not so sure that we should always require the user to provide the 'name', that might be painful, especially in the case of the 'firewall_rules' where in there might actually be many rules that need to be created.

So suggestions -

* for firewall_policies, how about we make the list of "FIREWALL_RULES" as a required argument.

*  for firewall_rules, how about we make "PROTOCOL" and "ACTION" as required arguments?

Thanks,
~Sumit.'}, {'account_id': 7753, 'date': '2013-07-18 19:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7708, 'date': '2013-07-19 06:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: (1 inline comment)

* In the firewall-rule-list summary

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 08:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: (1 inline comment)

Genrally looks good.

In neutronclient, there are two ways to specify a list at now.

- (a) Specify a single parameter and repeat it as we want (e.g., --fixed-ip ip_address=xxx --fixed-ip ip_address=yyy)
fixed-ips or securty_groups adopt this.
- (b) Specify a list in a single option: firewall-policy-create --firewall-rules "rule1 rule2 rule3"

I would like to ask two questsions to other reviewers:

- Do we use both styles (a) and (b)?
- If we use (b), what delimiter is better? whitespace, comma?  (Using whitespace as a delimiter requires us to quote the parameter list.)

A firewall policy may have many rules, so style (b) looks okay to me.
Regarding the second question, my vote is a comma, but it is not a strong opinion.

Note that we cannot use "neutron firewall-policy-create --filewall-rules rule1 rule2 rule3 NAME" because python argparse cannot distinguish a list parameter and positional arguments appropriately. It may be a bug of argparse but we need to avoid this problem.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 08:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

+1 (not +2) comes from the comment above.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 08:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37: Works for me

Build succeeded.

Akihiro, regarding the choice between whitespace or comma delimiter for lists, I actually tried to use comma before in patch 21.  To do that, I need to add a handler in neutronclient/common/untils.h.  

KC'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 14:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38: Works for me

To Akihiro's point, I think the option "b" is clearly better since option "a" would be very painful when the number of rules is very large.

I don't have a preference of using a comma separated list versus the space delimited within quotes, however in an earlier patch set (21) it was pointed out by another reviewer that the preference was for the latter. I believe the current implementation is consistent with that.'}, {'account_id': 5162, 'date': '2013-08-07 00:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38:

The latest patch worked for me. I was able to identify firewall rules by name when creating a firewall policy.'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-08-07 00:55:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 38: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This looks good, but wouldn't we want to hold on until the server-side reviews merge? Maybe this should be marked 'do not merge'?"}, {'account_id': 7753, 'date': '2013-08-07 01:17:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 38:

Tests: blueprint metadata-resource

commit_message:
Update tests to reflect queue metadata changes

This patch updates the system tests to align with the changes in the
create queue endpoint. This also adds tests for the new queue/metadata
endpoint.

Change-Id: I2654b531952f4a87031082dd7bd686448e6739fb
Tests: blueprint metadata-resource

[{'created': '2013-07-09 23:32:46.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure ExtGwModeTestCase unsets extension manager

Bug 1199557

Change-Id: If4e53ffca3bdeb4fb218918358437aca41489de4
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 15:13:06.000000000', 'message': 'Do not alter test_config global in test_extension_ext_gw_mode

Bug 1199557

Instead, allow subclasses to instruct the base test class which
API extension manager they should use as it is already done with
the plugin name.

commit_message:
Do not alter test_config global in test_extension_ext_gw_mode

Bug 1199557

Instead, allow subclasses to instruct the base test class which
API extension manager they should use as it is already done with
the plugin name.

Change-Id: If4e53ffca3bdeb4fb218918358437aca41489de4

commit_message:
Don't cache data from the API that could change.

The Cloud Server resource caches Nova server objects, which could change
between Heat calls.  Heat should get new data from the Nova API on each
run.

Fixes bug #1208559

Change-Id: I7dd8a99745cf8a3aab974468acae8dc1f85369ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 16:28:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_request_no_token_dummy cms dependency.

* tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py: test_request_no_token_dummy has a
dependency on the keystone.common.cms module importing subprocess prior
to running. The cms._ensure_subprocess() function does this. Call this
function to ensure subprocess is imported before symbols from that
module are needed.

This fix is needed because testr runs tests in non deterministic order
which means that each test needs to be able to run on its own (eg in its
own process without any other tests running first) and they need to run
without interfering any other tests (each test must properly clean up
after itself). Prior to this commit test_request_no_token_dummy would
fail when executed on its own.

Change-Id: I3cf669b94ed77ad0cd729ead0b4162a3f1b8819f

This fix is needed because testr runs tests in non deterministic order

commit_message:
Fix test_request_no_token_dummy cms dependency.

* tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py: test_request_no_token_dummy has a
dependency on the keystone.common.cms module importing subprocess prior
to running. The cms._ensure_subprocess() function does this. Call this
function in the base test class's setUp method to ensure subprocess is
imported before symbols from that module are needed. Doing this in the
base setUp will ensure that this works for any additional tests with the
same dependency.

This fix is needed because testr runs tests in non deterministic order
which means that each test needs to be able to run on its own (eg in its
own process without any other tests running first) and they need to run
without interfering any other tests (each test must properly clean up
after itself). Prior to this commit test_request_no_token_dummy would
fail when executed on its own.

Closes-Bug: #1209300
Change-Id: I3cf669b94ed77ad0cd729ead0b4162a3f1b8819f

'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-01 16:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hey, Dan. Would you mind explaining why we need this in Horizon?'}, {'account_id': 8327, 'date': '2013-08-01 16:25:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Julie,

Currently Horizon does not need/use this functionality on it's own.  I am writing a dashboard plugin that will integrate some Red Hat Portal Services into OpenStack.  Part of this functionality will involve collecting logs (sosreport) which needs to be collected as root.  I figured it made sense to use rootwrap consistently across the OpenStack components instead of rolling something on my own, this way other plugins would be able to use this functionality as well.  Does that make sense?

Thanks, Dan"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-06 14:31:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Dan, thanks for the explanation. Using rootwrap consistently over the projects makes sense. However, we do not usually accept new patches that introduce new dependencies or new code that isn't actually being used."}, {'account_id': 8327, 'date': '2013-08-06 15:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1208876'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-06 16:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have a concern that modules Horizon does not use directly tend to be out-of-date since many developer don't take care of them.

Another question is "Can't you avoid using local programs or scripts directly?".

Finally, this topic seems to be done as a blueprint rather than a bug since this needs a discussion.'}, {'account_id': 8327, 'date': '2013-08-06 16:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So it is not part of normal release management to update the oslo-incubator/openstack common modules?  That seems like an oversight, as oslo-incubator has a simple update.py process to keep these up to date.  Also, as a plugin developer that would use this feature we would have vested interest in ensuring that it was kept up to date.  

Unforunately I can not avoid using local commands/scripts for the types of interactions I am developing.'}, {'account_id': 8327, 'date': '2013-08-06 17:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Created blueprint as well: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/horizon-rootwrap'}, {'account_id': 8327, 'date': '2013-08-07 17:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Abandon.'}]

An error would occur if you attempted to attach a volume that
was created from a snapshot. The 3PAR backends does not have a

has a 'snapCPG' field. This patch will now look for the 'snapCPG'

Change-Id: Ic7dab730a68339edb4273e4fbb6f8e45e37808b3
Fixes: bug 1207913

An error would occur if you attempted to attach a volume that
was created from a snapshot. The 3PAR backends does not have a
'userCPG' entry in the volume data on the backend, it instead
has a 'snapCPG' field. This patch will now look for the 'snapCPG'

commit_message:
3PAR volumes created from snaps failed to attach

An error would occur if you attempted to attach a volume that
was created from a snapshot. The 3PAR backends does not have a
'userCPG' entry in the volume data on the backend, it instead
has a 'snapCPG' field. This patch will now look for the 'snapCPG'
entry and use that CPG when attaching the volume created from a
snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic7dab730a68339edb4273e4fbb6f8e45e37808b3
Fixes: bug 1207913

[{'created': '2013-08-05 18:25:48.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly setup ML2 mechanism_drivers

The ML2 code in devstack was not correctly configuring the mechanism_drivers
when asked to do so. This corrects the typo in the variable assignment, and
also actually sets these in the plugin configuration file.

Fixes bug 1208557

Change-Id: I3746ca099f45d44dcf1cc2ca1c3726745b8e8a1d
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly setup ML2 mechanism_drivers

The ML2 code in devstack was not correctly configuring the mechanism_drivers
when asked to do so. This corrects the typo in the variable assignment, and
also actually sets these in the plugin configuration file.

Fixes bug 1208557

Change-Id: I3746ca099f45d44dcf1cc2ca1c3726745b8e8a1d

[{'created': '2013-08-02 12:35:35.000000000', 'message': "Update baremetal to work with the latest DIB

Adjust DevStack to the current DIB's naming to kernel/ramdisk.

BM_HOST_CURRENT_KERNEL is removed since the kernel is extracted from
a diskimage with the ramdisk and the host's kernel is not used.

BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK is added to control whether use DIB or not.

If you set BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=False, you must BM_DEPLOY_KERNEL
and BM_DEPLOY_RAMDISK to point existing deploy kernel/ramdisk.

Fixes 1207719

Change-Id: I62af0b1942b07ac12665c0ed3619d64c1cccbe1f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-02 12:36:37.000000000', 'message': "Update baremetal to work with the latest DIB

Adjust DevStack to the current DIB's naming to kernel/ramdisk.

BM_HOST_CURRENT_KERNEL is removed since the kernel is extracted from
a diskimage with the ramdisk and the host's kernel is not used.

BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK is added to control whether use DIB or not.

If you set BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=False, you must BM_DEPLOY_KERNEL
and BM_DEPLOY_RAMDISK to point existing deploy kernel/ramdisk.

Fixes bug 1207719

Change-Id: I62af0b1942b07ac12665c0ed3619d64c1cccbe1f
"}]
commit_message:
Update baremetal to work with the latest DIB

Adjust DevStack to the current DIB's naming to kernel/ramdisk.

BM_HOST_CURRENT_KERNEL is removed since the kernel is extracted from
a diskimage with the ramdisk and the host's kernel is not used.

BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK is added to control whether use DIB or not.

If you set BM_BUILD_DEPLOY_RAMDISK=False, you must BM_DEPLOY_KERNEL
and BM_DEPLOY_RAMDISK to point existing deploy kernel/ramdisk.

Fixes bug 1207719

Change-Id: I62af0b1942b07ac12665c0ed3619d64c1cccbe1f

commit_message:
Add keystoneclient support for cinder.

Add an ability to ask keystone about users and groups
through keystoneclient in cinder.

blueprint volume-acl

Change-Id: Ice261e9709833d057722b4f13c404df54e10b204

commit_message:
Generate temepst API doc from source

This change adds an rst file for every tempest module, with the
'automodule' macro.

The root of the API documetation will be in the 'API and test cases'
section on the main page.

https://review.openstack.org/39427

Change-Id: I4065a24328dc85bb158b15bdfddb10ee0839916b

subject: do not exit after first invalid file
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 14:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/13/40413/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/ae8f10a : SUCCESS in 24m 46s
'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-08-07 12:53:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The validate_individual_files(rootdir, exceptions) contains loops that run validation on all XML files (other than pom.xml) under the specified rootdir. As such validation already runs on all files, no?

The exit statement you are removing is only run after these loops have completed and is there to prevent the running of an actual build on all guides when it is known it will fail (due to validation errors found in one or more files)."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That's not correct.

At the moment the exit is inside the loop "for root, dirs, files in os.walk(rootdir):".

If you have an invalid file inside the first directory found in the root directory the script will exit, not parsing the other directories for invalid files.

I want that all directories inside the root are scanned for invalid files with one call to the script. At the moment you have to call the script several times if having several invalid files in different directories in the root.

After this patch it's outside this loop and the method is working like expected.'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-07 13:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-08-07 16:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Good thinking.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 16:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 17:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/13/40413/1/gate/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/9e585b7 : SUCCESS in 24m 23s
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 17:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

At the moment tools/validate.py exits after it found an
invalid file.

I think it's better to always validate all files and to

commit_message:
do not exit after first invalid file

At the moment tools/validate.py exits after it found an
invalid file.

I think it's better to always validate all files and to
exit then if any invalid file was found. This way the
creator of a review request can fix all found issues in
all files and has not to create several patch sets.

Change-Id: Ic5668f0791680802b8cef3b5e1016c9dc76479b9

'}, {'created': '2013-08-05 17:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: download images using the common library

The change is a refactor of the image download code in the xenapi
driver, and a modification to use the common image library for image
downloads. This makes it possible to use all qemu-img supported image
formats with a XenServer compute node.

Related to blueprint blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: Icf2d668b01e86f0f6d49d6ae45903e2a3844d101
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: download images using the common library

The change is a refactor of the image download code in the xenapi
driver, and a modification to use the common image library for image
downloads. This makes it possible to use all qemu-img supported image
formats with a XenServer compute node.

Related to blueprint blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: Icf2d668b01e86f0f6d49d6ae45903e2a3844d101

commit_message:
xenapi: Refactor common image download library

Refactor and test nova/virt/images.py, so that we can reuse the code
with the xenapi driver. This will enable the use of all qemu-img
recognised image formats with XenServer.

Related to blueprint xenapi-supported-image-import-export

Change-Id: I276ef7d4933a5b73c9df2a0b9787a46f6f2ac096

commit_message:
Cisco plugin db code cleanup, part II

Remove an unused table.
Prefix Cisco tablenames with cisco_.
Make full use of neutron model base class.
DRY out the nexusport binding queries.
Follow coding guidelines for imports.
Improve cisco/db/network_db_v2.py test coverage.
Improve cisco/db/nexus_db_v2.py test coverage.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 05:42:04.000000000', 'message': 'Delete useless and wrong NOTE in NEC Plugin

This commit deletes useless and wrong comment in NEC Plugin.
There is a misunderstanding about parallel testing. Testr forks
subprocess to run tests, so there are no side effects to other
processes.

But we have to consider side effects to subsequent tests by the
same worker, so this commit adds clear_nec_ini() to Cleanup.

Change-Id: I5c7950617cdf5d66f5f5cf3334bf2d5e617148eb
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 06:07:55.000000000', 'message': 'Delete useless and wrong NOTE in NEC Plugin

This commit deletes useless and wrong comment in NEC Plugin.
There is a misunderstanding about parallel testing. Testr forks
subprocess to run tests, so there are no side effects to other
processes.

In addition, there is a case that _clean_nec_ini() is not called,
so this commit add it to Cleanup to make sure it is called.

Change-Id: I5c7950617cdf5d66f5f5cf3334bf2d5e617148eb
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 08:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Delete useless and wrong comments in NEC Plugin

This commit deletes useless and wrong comments in NEC Plugin, and adds
_clean_nec_ini() to Cleanup to make sure it is called.

Fixes: bug #1208716
Change-Id: I5c7950617cdf5d66f5f5cf3334bf2d5e617148eb
'}]
commit_message:
Delete useless and wrong comments in NEC Plugin

This commit deletes useless and wrong comments in NEC Plugin, and adds
_clean_nec_ini() to Cleanup to make sure it is called.

Fixes: bug #1208716
Change-Id: I5c7950617cdf5d66f5f5cf3334bf2d5e617148eb

[{'created': '2013-08-07 15:09:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of DELETE obj reqs with old timestamp

The DELETE object REST API was creating tombstone files with old
timestamps, potentially filling up the disk, as well as sending
container updates.

Here we now make DELETEs with a request timestamp return a 409 (HTTP
Conflict) if a data file exists with a newer timestamp, only creating
tombstones if they have a newer timestamp.

The key fix is to actually read the timestamp metadata from an
existing tombstone file (thanks to Pete Zaitcev for catching this),
and then only create tombstone files with newer timestamps.

We also prevent PUT and POST operations using old timestamps as well.

Change-Id: I631957029d17c6578bca5779367df5144ba01fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of DELETE obj reqs with old timestamp

The DELETE object REST API was creating tombstone files with old
timestamps, potentially filling up the disk, as well as sending
container updates.

Here we now make DELETEs with a request timestamp return a 409 (HTTP
Conflict) if a data file exists with a newer timestamp, only creating
tombstones if they have a newer timestamp.

The key fix is to actually read the timestamp metadata from an
existing tombstone file (thanks to Pete Zaitcev for catching this),
and then only create tombstone files with newer timestamps.

We also prevent PUT and POST operations using old timestamps as well.

Change-Id: I631957029d17c6578bca5779367df5144ba01fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix handling of DELETE obj reqs with old timestamp

The DELETE object REST API was creating tombstone files with old
timestamps, potentially filling up the disk, as well as sending
container updates.

Here we now make DELETEs with a request timestamp return a 409 (HTTP
Conflict) if a data file exists with a newer timestamp, only creating
tombstones if they have a newer timestamp.

The key fix is to actually read the timestamp metadata from an
existing tombstone file (thanks to Pete Zaitcev for catching this),
and then only create tombstone files with newer timestamps.

We also prevent PUT and POST operations using old timestamps as well.

Change-Id: I631957029d17c6578bca5779367df5144ba01fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
refactor port binding codes

Bug #1195047

This patch:
1. removes the iteration in get_ports to call extend_dict_binding
2. uses a unified way for plugins to do this kind of stuff

ml2 will enhance the binding so that it can have different binding
for port according to port's host.
mlnx and bigswitch are also exceptions due to the dynamic binding info.

Change-Id: I5a77eb7395e14482a856e033f536f72a1bf82e06

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 15:04:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of DELETE obj reqs with old timestamp

The DELETE object REST API was creating tombstone files with old
timestamps, potentially filling up the disk, as well as sending
container updates.

Here we now make DELETEs with a request timestamp return a 409 (HTTP
Conflict) if a data file exists with a newer timestamp, only creating
tombstones if they have a newer timestamp.

The key fix is to actually read the timestamp metadata from an
existing tombstone file (thanks to Pete Zaitcev for catching this),
and then only create tombstone files with newer timestamps.

We also prevent PUT and POST operations using old timestamps as well.

Change-Id: I631957029d17c6578bca5779367df5144ba01fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of DELETE obj reqs with old timestamp

The DELETE object REST API was creating tombstone files with old
timestamps, potentially filling up the disk, as well as sending
container updates.

Here we now make DELETEs with a request timestamp return a 409 (HTTP
Conflict) if a data file exists with a newer timestamp, only creating
tombstones if they have a newer timestamp.

The key fix is to actually read the timestamp metadata from an
existing tombstone file (thanks to Pete Zaitcev for catching this),
and then only create tombstone files with newer timestamps.

We also prevent PUT and POST operations using old timestamps as well.

Change-Id: I631957029d17c6578bca5779367df5144ba01fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert CamelCase attribute naming to camel_case for servers V3 API

Convert cases of CamelCase attribute naming to camel_case in the
servers V3 API to make the v3 API as whole consistent in the naming
of attributes

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ie2c790ae8eb01f02d754911b0a10c4061d0b4a92

commit_message:
Thorough edit of the Required Configuration chapter.

Moved unordered steps into <procedures>. Corrected grammatical errors, and added descriptive tags.
Corrected passive -> active.
Fixed 'classs' and <programlisting> errors.
Removed extra white spaces.

Change-Id: I9b8676067d0491437c9d44af08dbab8b1de85f41

commit_message:
Update the module for new config file method

Since we have now an only config file (heat.conf) with this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36476/

This patch updates the module and delete old configuration files
support and add a test.

Also, I fixed some tab issues in manifests.
Fix bug #1207858

Change-Id: If3d044e2581156fa5ce4de19f5c740328efa0aa8
