revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 06:18:59.000000000', 'message': "Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups

Remove redundant parenthesis and use a consistent commenting style.

Some redundant parenthesis are retained to avoid this pep8 silliness:

  https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/126

i.e. to avoid E125 we have the choice of:

        if (md['source'] != source or
                md['destination'] != target or
                md['expiration'] < time.time()):
            raise InvalidEncryptedTicket(md['source'], md['destination'])

or:

        if ((md['source'] != source or
             md['destination'] != target or
             md['expiration'] < time.time())):
            raise InvalidEncryptedTicket(md['source'], md['destination'])

the latter is my preference.

Change-Id: Ic890bfc787a17fc77821e01e586806d1b558d530
"}]
commit_message:
Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups

Remove redundant parenthesis and use a consistent commenting style.

Some redundant parenthesis are retained to avoid this pep8 silliness:

  https://github.com/jcrocholl/pep8/issues/126

i.e. to avoid E125 we have the choice of:

        if (md['source'] != source or
                md['destination'] != target or
                md['expiration'] < time.time()):
            raise InvalidEncryptedTicket(md['source'], md['destination'])

or:

        if ((md['source'] != source or
             md['destination'] != target or
             md['expiration'] < time.time())):
            raise InvalidEncryptedTicket(md['source'], md['destination'])

the latter is my preference.

Change-Id: Ic890bfc787a17fc77821e01e586806d1b558d530

commit_message:
Bug fix add_floaters subcommand processing errors

* AttributeError for args.interface Certain argument
parameters are not set depending on whether you are entering
via the neutron or nova subcommands. If we simply set
self._args, we can access the expected arguments within
the appropriate subcommand and not try to blindly
set several of them on FloatingAddress class init.

* Subcommands do not show up as arguments, so we need to
set the subcommand name to a subparser_name argument
we can check to see which subcommand was called

* If the quantum api is down for any reason, the add
add floaters script will fail raising a chef error.  We
need only raise an error if there was an error adding
the IPs, not querying the quantum api.

Change-Id: Iac2cdae03bc3e2af39781994707b5139c401427f

Remove redundant global keyword in securemessage

The global keyword is only needed where we are assigning to the variable
in the method.

Change-Id: If9f3fcc5323e2a154db1f5b457ce3d5079f83253

commit_message:
Clarify precedence of secret_key_file

If secret_key_file is set, then secret_key is ignored. Clarify this in
the help strings.

Change-Id: Ie10ebb7c76e274b31ab9826a81373518c9b09e0a

Raise psutil requirement

Psutil API need use new 'require' condition for users to get network information.

Raise psutil requirement to >=0.6.1,<1.0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 19:26:43.000000000', 'message': "Update keyring minimum version

The keyring author has released an update that no longer
includes ptr in the setup_requires unless the command
being run is 'python setup.py ptr'. Let's use that version
to get around the weird dependency issue we have.

https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/issue/105/pytest-runner-should-be-in-test
https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/commits/29116566d46e

Change-Id: I0ea61e1bb264b9ed8b141332434672bb2b521e13
"}, {'created': '2013-08-07 02:27:46.000000000', 'message': "Update keyring minimum version

The keyring author has released an update that no longer
includes ptr in the setup_requires unless the command
being run is 'python setup.py ptr'. Let's use that version
to get around the weird dependency issue we have.

https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/issue/105/pytest-runner-should-be-in-test
https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/commits/29116566d46e

Change-Id: I0ea61e1bb264b9ed8b141332434672bb2b521e13
"}]
commit_message:
Update keyring minimum version

The keyring author has released an update that no longer
includes ptr in the setup_requires unless the command
being run is 'python setup.py ptr'. Let's use that version
to get around the weird dependency issue we have.

https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/issue/105/pytest-runner-should-be-in-test
https://bitbucket.org/kang/python-keyring-lib/commits/29116566d46e

Change-Id: I0ea61e1bb264b9ed8b141332434672bb2b521e13

commit_message:
Raise eventlet to 0.13.0

eventlet 0.13.0 provides the python 3.x compatible
timeout parameter in subprocess module
(https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/89)

The new requirement has a lower bound, but no upper bound. Should it be capped to avoid issues from API changes? How common are those with this library?

There's no home page listed for the package, so although it mentions python 3 support in the trove classifiers, it's not clear whether that is 3.1, 3.2, or 3.3. Do you know?"}, {'account_id': 7547, 'date': '2013-06-05 21:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

On http://pysnmp.sourceforge.net/ you can see, that the version runs with Python 2.4 through 3.3.

The PySNMP Developer said that they tend to publish new releases at least twice a year. And they anticipate three or four releases in 2013.
To ensure the compatibility I will add an upper bound. (pysnmp==4.2.4)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-05 22:59:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Approved

Thanks for digging up that information. Without a link to their home page on PyPI, I wasn't sure where the source was even being managed.

I'll update my review score after the upper bound is added, but I don't see any issue with giving this a +2."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-06-05 23:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

If we anticipate bug fix releases or other backwards-compatible releases, it's better to provide a range than a single version. That gives the distribution packagers a little flexibility with what their platform already supports.

For example, you might say >=4.2.4,<4.3.0 or >=4.2.4,<5.0 (the right answer depends on how much the PySNMP team works to maintain compatibility, so if you're not sure go with the smaller range)."}, {'account_id': 7547, 'date': '2013-06-14 07:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-06-14 07:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Add pysnmp needed for Ceilometer/HardwareAgent/SNMPInspector

The actual PySNMP version runs with Python 2.4 through 3.3
For more information about PySNMP see http://pysnmp.sourceforge.net/
Changelog: http://pysnmp.sourceforge.net/changes.html

Change-Id: I29986f7ca96079b4cbc1d7d96f9abe2bfc3c9d5f

@John - good stuff!

Some small things:

I think, if we moved make_step_decorator to VMOps, we could use:

    step = self.make_step_decorator(context, instance)

instead of:

    step = make_step_decorator(context, instance,
                               self._update_instance_progress)

But it's up to you really.

commit_message:
xenapi: remove dup code in make_step_decorator

There is duplicate code in the VMOps class and the make_step_decorator
function. This change makes the make_step_decorator class share code
with the VMOps class for updating progress.

Part of the steps towards unifying spawn and finish_migration.

Change-Id: I98ea9998ba5968f438b69e2b90331ae25cade3e6

commit_message:
Make NovaObject.get() avoid lazy-load when defaulting

Right now, NovaObject.get() will not properly emulate the dict
get() operation where a default value is returned if unset.

This makes it do that, and avoid attempting a lazy-load in the case
where a default is passed for a not-loaded value.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I298d44b82591c14e877b56744eace5d9ddb93198

commit_message:
CLI support for disabling SNAT

blueprint l3-ext-gw-modes

Adds the --disable-snat option to the router-gateway-set command

Change-Id: I1e6e339e3332d7073f761f407318811f22d283b1

commit_message:
Fix selector syntax

There is no 'text' HTML element, it's men to be an ID selector. Seems to
be only used at openstack_dashboard/templates/500.html:65.

commit_message:
Bump pbr requirment to 0.5.21

Removes the need for setuptools_git. Also, change the upper bound,
as the next planned release will be 1.0 and we'd like to coordinate
that move.

Change-Id: I9a9ff8c62f800da3bf02d4afb3bc24ddfd0d24d5

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 12:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/78/39678/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/e0286d9 : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/78/39678/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/64313ef/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 26s

- http://logs.openstack.org/78/39678/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/47fa51d : SUCCESS in 5m 21s
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-01 12:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-08-01 12:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi!

ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py => you are working on the same code chunck as Mehdi in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39031/5/ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py "with pipeline.PublishContext(...". Not a pb even with git?

About the message_id, I asked 2 questions (prefixed with >>>) in a comment in this review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39031/5/tests/api/v2/test_post_samples_scenarios.py about what you are working on now: 

""

OK thx for the explanation: I didn't noticed the second pipeline + I forgot the PublisherContext per source => now I understand! :o) So with the same source in the samples, you should have only one message (containing 2 samples) x 2 pipelines = 2 messages published "as always". I thought that the message_id was an identifier for the sample, but it is actually an identifier for the transport unit. Interesting.

>>> No need for a "sample_id" at all?

-----------------------------------------

message_id forbidden in the API => +1 reviewed! :o)

-----------------------------------------

"Next step is to modify the PublishContext to return the generated message_id" => Nice!

>>> When messages are duplicated on multiple pipelines (I suppose to deal with multiple usages: pipeline on UDP for simple monitoring, pipeline on TCP for messages dedicated to billing, ...) => message_id is duplicated too? Or another message_id is generated on each pipeline? In case of one generated message_id per pipeline, what to send back to the API? An array of message_id for each sample?

""'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 12:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/78/39678/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/cc67ffa : SUCCESS in 3m 16s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/78/39678/2/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/fd02aff/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 5m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/78/39678/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/f0f1800 : SUCCESS in 11m 14s
- http://logs.openstack.org/78/39678/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/5d7b544 : SUCCESS in 5m 17s
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-01 13:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, Mehdi or me will have to rebase and resolve conflicts. That's life.

>>> No need for a "sample_id" at all?

Well actually message_id is a very poorly chosen name, but mainly historical. It's actually the sample id, that's why I've called the sample attribute "id".

>>> When messages are duplicated on multiple pipelines (I suppose to deal with multiple usages: pipeline on UDP for simple monitoring, pipeline on TCP for messages dedicated to billing, ...) => message_id is duplicated too? Or another message_id is generated on each pipeline? In case of one generated message_id per pipeline, what to send back to the API? An array of message_id for each sample?

"message_id" is actually "sample_id". I can't help with that, that would break the API to change the name :(

So the sample_id/message_id is going to be the same on each pipeline, which is probably a good idea if you need to compare things.'}, {'account_id': 7336, 'date': '2013-08-01 17:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I agree with the utility of comparing message ID across the two pipelines. As more discussion comes up around multiple message destinations (ref. cadf and other talk) the ability to verify could be useful.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-08-01 18:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7336, 'date': '2013-08-01 18:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-07-18 03:49:36.000000000', 'message': "Raise warlock requirement to >=1.0.1,<2 and jsonschema to
>=1.0.3,!=1.4.0,<2

Glance PATCH API need use new 'require' condition for schema to validate
income requests.

See bug #1202391 for details.

commit_message:
Raise warlock requirement

Glance PATCH API need use new 'require' condition for schema to validate
income requests.

Raise warlock requirement to >=1.0.1,<2 as older warlock requires a too
old jsonschema to be useful

See bug #1202391 for details.

Change-Id: Iee1b514a6d1387ddc7cae54092fa24d88e3928e3
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add NOVA_DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS setting

This translates through to default_log_levels in /etc/nova.conf

Change-Id: I0b3b2dc5617b26fa35c919778409786148d69d69

 * Implemented Resource class which represents a dict as an object
 * Wrapped values returned by Conductor API into Resource
 * Changed Conductor to support the following behaviour:
 ** For major objects (Cluster, Templates), API returns the object on
    read, create and update operations. None is returned on delete.
 ** For nested objects (Node Groups and Instances), API returns
    object ID on create. None is returned on update and delete.

commit_message:
A Resource implementation for Conductor

 * Implemented Resource class which represents a dict as an object
 * Wrapped values returned by Conductor API into Resource
 * Made DB layer return datetime objects as strings
 * Changed Conductor to support the following behaviour:
 ** For major objects (Cluster, Templates), API returns the object on
    read, create and update operations. None is returned on delete.
 ** For nested objects (Node Groups and Instances), API returns
    object ID on create. None is returned on update and delete.

Change-Id: I83d9177c778654154c550fc66061bf320de877e4

commit_message:
Rename Quantum to Neutron

quantumclient is gone upstream and has been replaced by neutronclient.

This patch retains the OS::Quantum::XX namespace

Fixes: bug #1197208

Change-Id: Id48f9598ea1884132d411ad533770ae49494102b

commit_message:
Add help option to Config Settings

This way it is possible to generate the config
files from the used config values automatically
(like done e.g. in other OpenStack modules)

Change-Id: I2683743330a8d3589637d967e16b5ba130bd45e1

There are two changes here, and it seems like they belong in separate patches.

Change #1 is to filter the a parameter schema snippet through a Template object and out the other side completely unchanged before passing it to Parameter (singular). I'm struggling to see the benefit of this as well.

Change #2 is to pass an actual Template object instead of a dictionary to Parameters (plural).

#2 is clearly an overdue improvement.
#1 is less obvious, but in the context of I8720c62e41a1f182584c4518163d422784c23b37 (which ought to depend on this), it looks to be the right way to go.

So let's get these in, but as two separate patches."}, {'account_id': 7761, 'date': '2013-08-05 03:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 04:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix test cases pass dict schema directly as parameter schema object

Filter the parameter schema snippet through a Template object and out
the other side completely unchanged before passing it to Parameter.

Implements blueprint hot-parameters

Change-Id: I8c3dd99c1a2f460f50a92565d9098c70c9e77a8a

+1 to what Thomas said.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-01 09:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the comments ;)
Yeah, the deleted_at by itself can achieve the same goal. The reason I added an additional "deleted" column is to align with other OpenStack components. And also it will make the work  easier when we decide to make use of the oslo.db package.
But I am fine to take the "deleted" column out, if we all think that the benefit of maintaining such an alignment doesn't outweigh the overhead of this additional column.'}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-08-03 04:00:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

agree with Thomas"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-05 08:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-05 09:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-05 11:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 12:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/16/38816/2/check/gate-heat-pep8/8c630a6 : SUCCESS in 1m 53s
- http://logs.openstack.org/16/38816/2/check/gate-heat-python26/441067e : SUCCESS in 4m 19s
- http://logs.openstack.org/16/38816/2/check/gate-heat-python27/7029dcc : SUCCESS in 2m 16s

- http://logs.openstack.org/16/38816/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/c12bbff : SUCCESS in 44m 01s

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-05 12:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Question: why do the UserCreds and Event tables require a soft-delete column? They are already tied to exactly one stack (the same as, e.g. Resources), so why not just look at the deleted attribute on the stack?

Even the event_get_all_by_tenant() function goes through everything one stack at a time."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-06 07:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for raising the concern. I did think about that before as well, and finally chose to apply soft-detete for Event and UserCred data for the following reasons.
1. If a stack was deleted, it would not make much sense to let the associated UserCreds and Event data stay unaffected (They were in fact deleted data) in the database tables. This can make things more explicit, otherwise it would have to always use stack data to infer whether a UserCreds or Event record is deleted.
2. Event data is only iterated one stack at a time for now. But we may want to retrieve event data in other ways in the future.
3. This is again to align with the other OpenStack components. They all use soft-delete for all their tables. So making these two table soft-delete will make future work (leveraging oslo DB package) easier.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-06 09:12:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

(1 inline comment)

Fair points. To me it doesn't make a lot of sense to think of an event as 'deleted'. An event happened. It's associated with a stack. That stack is either in the deleted state or it isn't, but that is immaterial to the event. Events don't have names, so there's no reason to care about conflicts. At some point we will remove the stack and all of its associated events from the database. (Foreign Key constraints prevent you removing the stack without also removing the events.)

I actually think it's unlikely that we'll ever access events directly without going through the stack, simply because events don't contain any user/tenant information, so accessing them directly is going to create a security hole.

As for the UserCreds, I see them as just an extension of the Stack table (it's a 1:1 relationship). Same deal with foreign key constraint applies. Actually, it would probably be wise to go ahead and continue to hard-delete the UserCreds when a stack is deleted, just to minimise the length of time we are storing the user's credentials in the database (though hopefully with the trusts bp this whole table will go away soon).

I'll defer to you on the best thing to do regarding oslo.db; you are definitely the expert. A couple of questions to consider:
* After implementing the previous feedback (to use deleted_time instead of a separate boolean field to determine deletion status), is it still an advantage for oslo.db compatibility to have Event/UserCreds soft-deletable?
* If it's important for Event/UserCreds, why didn't you implement the same thing for Resource?"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-06 09:16:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

BTW ditto for raw_template. That really is just a part of a stack (every stack has exactly one, unique raw_template), and doesn't even deserve its own table."}, {'account_id': 6800, 'date': '2013-08-06 19:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-07 00:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 01:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
DB models and migration scripts for soft delete

Only apply soft-delete on stack table for now. event, user_creds
and raw_template records will remain unchanged after stack
deletion, and those 'deleted' data can be cleaned up by the
purge_delete command provided in follow patch.

blueprint event-persistence

Change-Id: I173cc6037615ff252968297981c36e51cb9d3fd3

[{'created': '2013-08-02 04:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix v3 api images related links

With the images extension demoted from core status the resource
is now at /v3/os-images instead of /v3/images. This changeset
fixes up the various links that are automatically generated to
point at the correct place

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api
DocImpact

Change-Id: I79f6a696ac4b3d704b1f1275259de81f523b9139
'}]
commit_message:
Fix v3 api images related links

With the images extension demoted from core status the resource
is now at /v3/os-images instead of /v3/images. This changeset
fixes up the various links that are automatically generated to
point at the correct place

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api
DocImpact

Change-Id: I79f6a696ac4b3d704b1f1275259de81f523b9139

commit_message:
Do not use context in db.sqla.api private methods

We shouldn't check context in private methods,
because context are already checked by public
methods.

Change-Id: I5582c7761c4fb2b2fbfee6e5a2ba77a4c7dd8583

commit_message:
Finish DB session cleanup

Remove session parameter from:
 agent_build_get_by_triple()
 bw_usage_update()
They are never called with session parameter

Rename aggregate_get_query() -> _aggregate_get_query()
because it is private method

Enable N309

implement blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Idd43d230105cb140d8825a251f03a58ea28cce90

commit_message:
Clean up session in db.sqla.api.migration_* methods

Remove session parameter from migration_get():
Add _migration_get() that contains same logic that old migration_get(),
for internal usage, and new migration_get() that doesn't contains session
parameter.

Remove session parameters from:
migration_get_unconfirmed_by_dest_compute()
migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node()

They are never called with session parameter.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

commit_message:
Clean up session in db.sqla.api.network_* and sec_groups_* methods

Remove session parameter from network_get():
Create _network_get() that contains same logic that old network_get(),
for internal usage, and new network_get() doesn't contains session
parameter.

Remove session parameter from:
security_group_default_rule_get()
and
security_group_default_rule_list()

They are never called with session parameter.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: If09d13112a35ca40dd288705cfb727d3c7a74774

commit_message:
Clean up session in db.sqla.api.get_ec2 methods

Remove session parameter from public methods

  get_ec2_volume_id_by_uuid
  get_volume_uuid_by_ec2_id
  get_ec2_snapshot_id_by_uuid
  get_snapshot_uuid_by_ec2_id
  get_ec2_instance_id_by_uuid
  get_instance_uuid_by_ec2_id

Because they are never called with session parameter
we could just remove it.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Iecced3cf144de4f58a1169ed2d8f6940e229bedb

instance_get_all_by_filters
instance_metadata_get
instance_metadata_update

instance_system_metadata_update

are fully covered by tests so we are able just to remove
session parameter.

Convert rows to dict in one line instead of 4.

'}]
commit_message:
Clean up db.sqla.api.instance_* methods

Remove session parameter from public db methods:
instance_get_all_by_filters
instance_metadata_get
instance_metadata_update
instance_system_metadata_get
instance_system_metadata_update

They were never called with session parameter and they
are fully covered by tests so we are able just to remove
session parameter.

Clean up instance_metadata_get and instance_system_metadata_get
Convert rows to dict in one line instead of 4.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ib2f50cc4b5a7a2e283d891141a88c7b1ff9f7d43

commit_message:
Allow for alternative grub config file

The grub config file passed into sed for the tty purge doesn't exist on
fedora, causing image builds to fail.

can't read /boot/grub/grub.cfg: No such file or directory

Change-Id: I015abba81bf67e2ed7c5a2876adeaef641a6cc3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-07 11:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Change the rootfs label in F18 and F19

The images produced by the diskimage-builder have their filesystem with
a label of "cloudimg-rootfs", The regex changing fstab on fedora didn't
match the F19 case.

This regex matches both
F18 :
LABEL=_/   /         ext4    defaults        1 1
F19 :
UUID=f2da0fc8-2e12-4a6e-8e95-a31a474aa1a8 / ext4 defaults,noatime 0 0

Change-Id: Iafcf5e069199f1df76874309b2d5064f343fb5e5
'}]
commit_message:
Change the rootfs label in F18 and F19

The images produced by the diskimage-builder have their filesystem with
a label of "cloudimg-rootfs", The regex changing fstab on fedora didn't
match the F19 case.

This regex matches both
F18 :
LABEL=_/   /         ext4    defaults        1 1
F19 :
UUID=f2da0fc8-2e12-4a6e-8e95-a31a474aa1a8 / ext4 defaults,noatime 0 0

Change-Id: Iafcf5e069199f1df76874309b2d5064f343fb5e5

commit_message:
Install libz to make os-collect-config buildable

Some other -dev libs end up pulling it in, so this was not detectable
when things depended on os-collect-config. However, in order to compile
lxml we need libz-dev.

Change-Id: I8dd3a93b71b87e40977f85755ac2a56d6740399a

commit_message:
Switch heat-cfntools element from git to pip install

This will also be required for the os-*-config elements
as a prerequisite for images being built as part of the
tempest heat gate tests.

Change-Id: Ic0aa42a08dd189336d5ec390e4e96a160357263f

"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-07-16 09:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This patch should be split up IMO.

The commit message implies that it's primarily focused on mongoDB, whereas it includes API support for pagination as well and also some changes to the hbase and sqlalchemy drivers (in the latter pcase, seems to duplicate some of the changes in https://review.openstack.org/35454)

How about a split like:

1. skeletal storage driver changes (new marker params etc.)
2. API layer changes
3. mongoDB implementation
4. sqlalchemy implmenetation
5. hbase implementation (could be a future patch that's not ready yet)

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-07-17 09:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-07-17 09:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

This patch is only add MongoDB driver support of pagination.
The API part will be sent in another patch. 
For the sqlalchemy pagination driver support, you can follow this link: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35454/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 09:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

(3 inline comments)

I think this commit should not contain changes to storage implementations other than impl_mongodb.

Another concern is markers efficiency: MongoDB supports limit+offset params in query so why not simply use this instead of complex markers?

+Some small typos."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-07-23 16:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-07-24 02:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-07-24 02:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Alexei Kornienko

Another concern is markers efficiency: MongoDB supports limit+offset params in query so why not simply use this instead of complex markers?

For this question, IMO, MongoDB certainly supports limit+offset params in query. But it has performance issue when offset is a large number. The common way for pagination is where+limit, which can provide a better performance.

Please correct me if i am wrong.

Thanks
Fengqian'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 02:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me

commit_message:
Add pagination support for MongoDB

Paginate db query result of MongoDB.
The query methods support pagination include
get_resources, get_meters, get_alarms.
It is a part of blueprint paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

Change-Id: Id9162782a6c96b4bb0ed04d828791b8b1b1379d4

commit_message:
Fix docs build

It was broken by the updated docutils. The docutils version should be
fixed due to the openstack/requirements.

Partially Fixes: bug #1206670

Change-Id: Ie612519711cc8ebf9cb848f9d10826e74f2fa049
(cherry picked from commit 3de5642c6f7d77805d5892320637cf65ec2baf39)

Temporarily use sphinx 1.2b1

It looks like some parts of our code/docs breaks sphinx docs build.

Fixes: bug #1206670

(1 inline comment)

I have noticed that the namedtuple used for the sample don't have the 'source' field, before with the source in the PublishContext, the source was mandatory (or explicitly set the None) but removing it from the PublishContext made it optional. I think we need to add something to make it mandatory like before, perhaps with just adding it in sample.Sample mandatory field or set it with default cfg.CONF.sample_source.


Sample publisher via the agent was have source "openstack", now the source seems to be None (no sure, not tested, just reading code), just because cfg.CONF.sample_source seems no more used.


One missing publisher at ceilometer/collector/service.py#L254'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-08-01 08:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Remove source as a publisher argument

We used to have source as a publisher argument, but this anyway ends being
included in its Sample itself. So rather than complicating the internal
publishing API, simplify it and just include source as a Sample field.

Change-Id: Idb9d0c2b5969318dd16394a81d7d61c67f613892

commit_message:
Remove Brick's iscsi dependency on cinder

This patch removes Brick's iscsi/iscsi.py's
dependence on cinder.  Brick can't contain
cinder dependencies as it will be used in nova.

Fixes Bug #1209012

Change-Id: I046b5a53baecce81ba184cb7f30ec450f4738dae

commit_message:
Create key manager interface

This interface provides a thin wrapper around an underlying key
management implementation such as Barbican or a KMIP server. The key
manager interface is used by the volume encryption code to retrieve
keys for volumes.

This change is a copy-paste of the key manager interface accepted by
Nova. The major modifications are to the module imports (i.e.,
nova -> cinder).

Change-Id: I8f79165d66d67ad8faaca60946959c5a61811c59
Implements: blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

[{'created': '2013-08-05 18:33:15.000000000', 'message': 'GPFS Verify min release level for mmclone command

The gpfs driver makes heavy use of mmclone command.  This command
was added fairly recently.  Verify that the GPFS cluster is operating
at a level that supports mmclone at startup during prerequisite
checking in check_for_setup_error.

Need to verify:
1.  That gpfs cluster is at required level
2.  That filesystem(s) are also operating at required level.

Change-Id: Ie71d0b814d77b544e1a456d110882c1a02a5b2e5
Fixes: bug #1204266
'}]
commit_message:
GPFS Verify min release level for mmclone command

The gpfs driver makes heavy use of mmclone command.  This command
was added fairly recently.  Verify that the GPFS cluster is operating
at a level that supports mmclone at startup during prerequisite
checking in check_for_setup_error.

Need to verify:
1.  That gpfs cluster is at required level
2.  That filesystem(s) are also operating at required level.

Change-Id: Ie71d0b814d77b544e1a456d110882c1a02a5b2e5
Fixes: bug #1204266

commit_message:
Added 2 quota related test cases for Neutron API

This submission adds two test cases namely 'test_show_quotas' and
'test_update_list_reset_quotas' in the script test_quotas.py. The
supporting methods are added to network_client.py.'base.py' file is
modified so as to support admin credentials to manage quota.

Change-Id: I96caa9c2146a776bfe43f12d35cac738c4dcabe5
Implements: blueprint quantum-test-l2-abstraction

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 04:29:47.000000000', 'message': 'Replace 404 code when security group not found

Method add_rules() incorrectly interprets exception status code 409 as "not
found". The correct status code is 404, as it is used in the rest of this
module. This patch corrects the problem

Change-Id: Icd5ae994ee36edc1534dba680083aaecb7a01564
'}]
commit_message:
Replace 404 code when security group not found

Method add_rules() incorrectly interprets exception status code 409 as "not
found". The correct status code is 404, as it is used in the rest of this
module. This patch corrects the problem

Change-Id: Icd5ae994ee36edc1534dba680083aaecb7a01564

subject: Reduce default token duration/expiration to 1 hour
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6534, 'name': 'David Chadwick', 'email': 'd.w.chadwick@truetrust.co.uk', 'username': 'd-w-chadwick'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-25 18:10:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Just wanted to raise this for discussion. If we're going to abandon token revocation in the long run, we should begin by testing against tokens with a much shorter lifespan as soon as possible."}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-07-25 18:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Surely you dont need to test short token durations by altering the default time. Cant you simply set the config value to a very short time (like 5 mins) and try that.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-25 18:22:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Absolutely, but it's the difference between a gate job testing the change and an entire community."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-25 18:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/6544 : SUCCESS in 1m 49s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/4917/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 02s
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-keystone-python26/5429 : SUCCESS in 15m 10s
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/5447 : SUCCESS in 7m 39s
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/35597 : SUCCESS in 47m 09s
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/2939 : FAILURE in 17m 30s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-testr-full/1767 : FAILURE in 28m 34s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/35285 : SUCCESS in 47m 31s
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/7574 : SUCCESS in 19m 19s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/72/38672/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/21184 : SUCCESS in 24m 08s
'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-26 19:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-07-27 07:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-07-29 17:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2013-07-29 18:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

did you run this change by the other PTLs.  You may want to give folks a heads up on this'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-07-29 19:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Looks good, just one question on documentation.'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2013-07-30 20:49:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

After discussing this in the keystone IRC meeting it became clear that our stakeholders would not be ready for a reduced token expiration time. Thus by changing the default we have a high probability of surprising them with some misery.  And we won't have a solution for their misery until Icehouse.   Thus we should not surprise them with this unneeded pain until they have 1) been well briefed on what is gonna happen and 2) we have fully implemented an approach that allows reduced token duration to work without breaking folks"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-07-30 21:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am going to mirror what Brant said here.  It is needed to move in this direction, but we need to make sure we have made it clear to the other projects that this is going to happen.  (I don't think that 1hr is a significant enough reduction to cause serious pain, but, this is not something to rush into and end up with ill-will because of)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-06-07 14:26:37.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable.

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files.  The simplest way to ensure that they cannot
is to make the instances_path directory and its children not
world-readable, writable, or executable before caching files there.

(Because we copy image files in multiple ways and may add more
ways in the future, controlling permissions on the directory is easier
than controlling permissions on the image files, in a manner free of
race conditions.)

Fixes bug #1129748

commit_message:
Ensure that instances_path is not world readable.

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files.  The simplest way to ensure that they cannot
is to make the instances_path directory and its children not
world-readable, writable, or executable before caching files there.

But that OpenStack runs as one user and libvirt runs QEMU guests as
another user, so we need to use group permissions to ensure that VMs
can still be run.

(Because we copy image files in multiple ways and may add more
ways in the future, controlling permissions on the directory is easier
than controlling permissions on the image files, in a manner free of
race conditions.)

Fixes bug #1129748

Change-Id: I90e290e9a4e3b85bb4df9d6344390801050e30bf

'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 08:34:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes create rbd volume from image v1 glance api

The RBD driver supports two methods of image cloning;
thin copy i.e. copy-on-write (requires v2 Glance API)

commit_message:
Fixes create rbd volume from image v1 glance api

The RBD driver supports two methods of image cloning;
thin copy i.e. copy-on-write (requires v2 Glance API)
and full copy (default if v2 Glance API is not available).

clone_image() was failing in the Glance V1 API case because
it was not returning a tuple, as expected by the volume
manager. Glance V2 support works fine.

Fixes: bug #1208617

Change-Id: I2e8605eaacfe8b65bdf47cb6ea40ef62d6f6b895

Going to leave at 0 for a bit. The change is fine, but I'd like to hear any rebuttals to my suggestion to remove the word Provided from the error message before +2/approving or -1'ing."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-31 11:20:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Re the text of the error messages, the exceptions we are catching already contain internationalised error messages for these cases, so we should just be using them. The UserKeyPairMissing exception has a message for that case too, but we're not raising it.

Which brings me to my greater point: we shouldn't be returning strings at all - we'll get more appropriate information by just raising exceptions (or, in half of the cases, just not catching exceptions)."}, {'account_id': 7676, 'date': '2013-08-03 07:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-03 08:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Returns text error when instance validation fails

Since heat now is able to return parsable errors by middleware, we
don't need to return jsonfied error strings here.

Fixes Bug 1204582

Change-Id: Id3d68b9996ad67df0e25c6db5754f73bfa1e8830

commit_message:
remove requests version max

This change removes the max version specified for requests since the
requirements project no longer limits it to 1.2.2.

Change-Id: I96d14b4a84d975e8b08e9271db8d5e13d78019ae

commit_message:
Do not paginate stack list unless page_size is set

Pagination on the server has not yet been implemented, however
the client assumes it is, causing infinite recursion when paginate
is called.

With this change, no pagination is attempted unless page_size is
specified. However the 'limit' parameter is still honored, so it
is still possible to cap the total number of results returned.

heatclient users should not set page_size until pagination has been
implemented on the server. The stack list in Horizon currently
does not attempt to paginate, so is not affected.

Fixes: bug #1207839
Change-Id: I4087d3a8af48206d6ebe3edc441469464e4a401a

commit_message:
Fix Stack instance delete method

The current instance delete method assumes that a Stack
instance can be passed to the manager delete method, however
the manager delete method only accepts a stack identifier.

Change-Id: I87c30be1ea43695b7e13953531ea282fd8d386f8

commit_message:
Add mock as a test requirement

A project-wide concensus is forming that mox should be phased
out and mock should be encouraged for writing new tests.

This change allow mock to be used for new tests.

Change-Id: I3cdf77bbeadd419b811bddcc31f048c1c6ec38bb

commit_message:
Improve the L3 Agent support

New features:
- send_arp_for_ha
- periodic_interval
- periodic_fuzzy_delay

Fix bug #1207563

Partial Cherry-pick from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39836/

Change-Id: Ibc3d6574a203408e6f141e31e33b23f102acf343

[{'created': '2013-07-26 03:38:13.000000000', 'message': 'Initial add of ceilometer recipes

These were migrated out of `openstack-compute` and into their
own cookbook.  This is an initial best-effort attempt.

Made the following changes, which differ from the recipes imported.
* Moved to openstack["metering"] attribute namespace.
* No longer performing source install.  This was done for folsom.
* No longer writing out an Apache virtualhost.  This was done to
  protect the folsom non-authenticated API endpoint.
* Templates write out as the ceilometer user/group vs nova.
* No longer including nova-common recipe.  It doesn't appear nova.conf
  is necessay (although I may be wrong).  The stackforge puppet manifests
  do not seem to do this [1].
* Added Strainerfile for testing.

  [1] https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-ceilometer).

commit_message:
Initial add of ceilometer recipes

These were migrated out of `openstack-compute` and into their
own cookbook.  This is an initial best-effort attempt.

Made the following changes, which differ from the recipes imported.
* Moved to openstack["metering"] attribute namespace.
* No longer performing source install.  This was done for folsom.
* No longer writing out an Apache virtualhost.  This was done to
  protect the folsom non-authenticated API endpoint.
* Templates write out as the ceilometer user/group vs nova.
* No longer including nova-common recipe.  It doesn't appear nova.conf
  is necessay (although I may be wrong).  The stackforge puppet manifests
  do not seem to do this [1].
* Added Strainerfile for testing.

  [1] https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-ceilometer).

bug 1187514
Change-Id: Ia97126e13e422037ad1f2c89debd9e4cdfa60b0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-05 06:39:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update allowed_hosts conditional statement

In the origin heat::db::mysql, if the value of $allowed_hosts
contains or equals to $host, then puppet will complain duplicate
declaration error. This patch is aim to update the allowed_hosts
conditonal statement in heat::db::mysql.

There are two cases to pass $allowed_hosts to $real_allowed_hosts:

   - If $allowed_hosts is array,then remove $host from $allowed_hosts;
   - elsif $allowed_hosts is string and not equivalent to $host;

At last, if $real_allowed_hosts is not undef, then run
heat::db::mysql::host_access

Add heat_db_mysql_spec for related test.

Fix bug 1206444

Change-Id: Iac6a32fb614c9ad19f9eaa3aaa883cb3bf9aa2ef
'}]
commit_message:
Update allowed_hosts conditional statement

In the origin heat::db::mysql, if the value of $allowed_hosts
contains or equals to $host, then puppet will complain duplicate
declaration error. This patch is aim to update the allowed_hosts
conditonal statement in heat::db::mysql.

There are two cases to pass $allowed_hosts to $real_allowed_hosts:

   - If $allowed_hosts is array,then remove $host from $allowed_hosts;
   - elsif $allowed_hosts is string and not equivalent to $host;

At last, if $real_allowed_hosts is not undef, then run
heat::db::mysql::host_access

Add heat_db_mysql_spec for related test.

Fix bug 1206444

Change-Id: Iac6a32fb614c9ad19f9eaa3aaa883cb3bf9aa2ef

commit_message:
RPC: Add MessageSecurity implementation

Add Message Security[1] class and exceptions
Also add process-local Key Storage and Caching facility.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/MessageSecurity

Change-Id: Ieced7ab6a9209c3e0291d26376a8d35c25175002

commit_message:
Add a couple more things to index before release

Most of the new features are in and oslo req's are
synched, making the cut off here and getting a new
client version pushed up to PyPi.

Change-Id: If208b2341db06b438851d7b2aaab541efc79ea35

commit_message:
Expose subresources for Chassis and Node

This patch will expose the "nodes" subresource of Chassis and the "ports"
subresource of Nodes. Linking and pagination is also available for those,
as well as in any other collection in the API.

Change-Id: Icf805b0c47cdcb0521b66b85b0ffd8dd41414fe9

[{'created': '2013-08-06 21:00:55.000000000', 'message': "Move volume_clear and clear_size opts up to driver

The block_device driver pulled in the clear and clear_size
options for it's own use and broke the inheritance model needed
for multiple backend configs.

This change moves the two configs up higher in the heirarchy to
driver.py so that it can be shared/used by all drivers if they desire.

This means that they are now set properly in volume_opts.  At some
point we shoudl restructure this a bit to allow multi-backends to
specify independent settings for these configs.

Fixes bug: 1208964

Change-Id: I6afbdecea637f7e7d3417be537ab71fe97bffda3
"}]
commit_message:
Move volume_clear and clear_size opts up to driver

The block_device driver pulled in the clear and clear_size
options for it's own use and broke the inheritance model needed
for multiple backend configs.

This change moves the two configs up higher in the heirarchy to
driver.py so that it can be shared/used by all drivers if they desire.

This means that they are now set properly in volume_opts.  At some
point we shoudl restructure this a bit to allow multi-backends to
specify independent settings for these configs.

Fixes bug: 1208964

Change-Id: I6afbdecea637f7e7d3417be537ab71fe97bffda3

commit_message:
Add checks locked nodes to db api

Checks that node is locked added to methods
destroy_node(), update_port(), destroy_port()
in db api.
Exception NodeLocked raised in case locked node.
Tests updated respectively.

Change-Id: I3218df016d35f80df7a707fd3f3c6dd40db81fd2

@Joshua -- well, we have to fix this bug one way or another. The other thing to bear in mind is that this is a pre-cursor step to delayed delete of instance files. For example, there's no particular reason to delete the files for an instance when then instance is deleted. Perhaps you only do it when you're getting low on compute node disk or when the disks are known to be relatively idle. Or perhaps you always just wait an hour in case the user regrets their delete and begs for forgiveness. Either way we need to be able to track the current "delete state" for instance files to be able to implement those features.

The first version of this patch used a local store to control this state, but people hated that, mostly because of issues around how to version the data store. Such is life.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-07-26 17:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: No score

Okie dokie, guess we'll see how it goes and adjust later if need-be."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-26 23:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-11 01:57:43.000000000', 'message': 'Retry failed instance file deletes.

This change adds a new column to the instances table named "reaped".
This column indicates that the instance files on disk have been
deleted for that instance, assuming that the virt driver you are
using supports that feature (which only libvirt does for now).

Then the flag instance_delete_interval specifies how often to
retry deletes. The default is five minutes. A value of zero will
disable retries.

This change is done in this way because reaping will become a more
generic concept in the next patch.

DocImpact: the following new flags are added...

 - instance_delete_interval: how often to try to clean up instance
   files

 - maximum_instance_delete_attempts: how many attempts to have before
   giving up

Change-Id: I895869e18f92ed57bd2f8c1683cf9a398d88b680
'}, {'created': '2013-07-11 07:00:38.000000000', 'message': 'Retry failed instance file deletes.

This change adds a new column to the instances table named "reaped".
This column indicates that the instance files on disk have been
deleted for that instance, assuming that the virt driver you are
using supports that feature (which only libvirt does for now).

Then the flag instance_delete_interval specifies how often to
retry deletes. The default is five minutes. A value of zero will
disable retries.

A second column is added to the instances table as well. This column,
named "reap_attempts" tracks the number of times we have tried to
clean up an instance's files. We give up after
maximum_instance_delete_attempts attempts.

This change is done in this way because reaping will become a more
generic concept in the next patch.

DocImpact: the following new flags are added...

 - instance_delete_interval: how often to try to clean up instance
   files

 - maximum_instance_delete_attempts: how many attempts to have before
   giving up

Resolves bug 1040110.

Change-Id: I895869e18f92ed57bd2f8c1683cf9a398d88b680

The number of attempts to delete instance files is tracked in

commit_message:
Retry failed instance file deletes

This change adds a new column to the instances table named "cleaned".
This column indicates that the instance files on disk have been
deleted for that instance, assuming that the virt driver you are
using supports that feature (which only libvirt does for now).

Then the flag instance_delete_interval specifies how often to
retry deletes. The default is five minutes. A value of zero will
disable retries.

The number of attempts to delete instance files is tracked in
system metadata. We give up after maximum_instance_delete_attempts
attempts at cleaning up the files.

This change is done in this way because cleaning will become a more
generic concept in the next patch.

DocImpact: the following new flags are added...

 - instance_delete_interval: how often to try to clean up instance
   files

 - maximum_instance_delete_attempts: how many attempts to have before
   giving up

Resolves bug 1040110.

Change-Id: I895869e18f92ed57bd2f8c1683cf9a398d88b680

Fix cleanup-keystone-tokens.sh to actually work

The user was not passed, which produced an auth denied message every
time the script was run.

commit_message:
Add support for Keystone V3 Auth in Horizon.

Set the minimum version of openstack_auth to 1.1.1 to run Horizon with
Keystone V3 Auth. Version 1.1.0 has a critical bug and needs to be
bumped to newer release.

Change-Id: I4c7cbe41bbb24a27d955a0af16de9d49bfc1e4c0
Implements: blueprint login-domain-support

'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-07-18 05:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Isn't this asserting that we need to pin <1.2.1? Also this change conflicts with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/35513/. This conflict will need to be resolved."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-07-18 15:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Clark, yes it conflicts/reverts the change you referenced.
But there are issues with that change:

It removed a pin with no consideration of the original reason for that pin

It added a new pin with no justification of why the new pin was needed

It used < rather than <= in the new pin, so invalidating the reason stated for the new pin'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-07-19 12:52:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,

Well, opposite way. We must allow python-requests 1.2.3 to be used, since that's what is in Sid. See:

http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=python-requests&searchon=names&suite=all&section=all

Please consider what's in the distributions before making arbitrary limits to older versions. On the packaging side, this is simply impossible to deal with."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:05:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note this patch will unbreak more than it breaks.
But yes the general sentiment it correct in that
we should avoid explicit version deps where possible.
So I'll adjust this to remove the invalid pin,
and we can then deal with bug 1182271 outside of openstack"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-19 13:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
removal invalid pin of python-requests<=1.2.2

The ping was invalid as it didn't actually include v1.2.3
which is the version generally available at present.

The original issue requiring the pin in lp 1182271
will be handled within the affected distro.

Change-Id: Ifb59c0d5eb7fed48b01c67ec19dc79e79657fe2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 21:45:16.000000000', 'message': 'Update cfn-init-data path to match current Heat

Since April 2013 /var/lib/cloud/data has been deprecated.
Os-collect-config does not search that path, so this means
seed-stack-config is completely broken now that os-collect-config is
used instead of cfn-hup.

Change-Id: Ifb040f3d5e6d8326e13c1a25adb39dc7e5dc1a6c

commit_message:
Update cfn-init-data path to match current Heat

Since April 2013 /var/lib/cloud/data has been deprecated.
Os-collect-config does not search that path, so this means
seed-stack-config is completely broken now that os-collect-config is
used instead of cfn-hup.

Change-Id: Ifb040f3d5e6d8326e13c1a25adb39dc7e5dc1a6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 21:25:25.000000000', 'message': "Bootstrap os-collect-config

os-apply-config is now being used to create the config file for
o-c-c but this doesn't exist until o-a-c is run by o-c-c (via o-r-c).
So a number of things need to happen for the first run of o-c-c to
succeed.

o Create a bootstrap a os-collect-config.conf to call o-r-c.
o Move the seed metadata to where o-c-c looks for it
  (/var/lib/heat-cfntools).
o Move the o-c-c config file to /etc/os-collect-config.conf.

Change-Id: I3b90975bcabc49f196b896cd6f6ebb2755428032
"}]
commit_message:
Bootstrap os-collect-config

os-apply-config is now being used to create the config file for
o-c-c but this doesn't exist until o-a-c is run by o-c-c (via o-r-c).
So a number of things need to happen for the first run of o-c-c to
succeed.

o Create a bootstrap a os-collect-config.conf to call o-r-c.
o Move the seed metadata to where o-c-c looks for it
  (/var/lib/heat-cfntools).
o Move the o-c-c config file to /etc/os-collect-config.conf.

Change-Id: I3b90975bcabc49f196b896cd6f6ebb2755428032

commit_message:
Ensure all errors raised from netaddr are caught

Some values would cause schema validation to fail, even if those values
were valid for the record type being created.

Change-Id: I5d85a6edd6bffeb2acf3d48037f1507611b18170

commit_message:
Pass the default_project_id when managing User.

User default_project_id for setting the default project of the User.

Fixes bug 1205520

Change-Id: I176d88bb6897c36404d8915385cc791adf10c586

'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-07-31 17:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do we really need any code in this __init__.py? If we are setting __all__ to just Controller, then I think that whoever is importing ironic.api.controllers.v1 should just import ironic.api.controllers.v1.controller directly.

On a side note, the class name is redundant. Perhaps that file should be renamed ironic.api.controllers.v1.root?'}, {'account_id': 6623, 'date': '2013-08-01 08:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think importing modules from v1 explicitly (i.e. ironic.api.controllers.v1.controller) might be redundant. Python allows us to make import statements shorter and more readable by defining __all__, so why should we ignore this feature?

IMO

from ironic.api.controllers import v1
c = v1.Controller

looks much better than 

from ironic.api.controllers.v1 import controller
c = controller.Controller'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-08-01 09:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

+1 Roman, shorter import statements looks better'}, {'account_id': 4919, 'date': '2013-08-01 14:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 14:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Delete controller to make code easy to read and understood

If we want to have  all in __init__, i believe it's a good ideal to move
Controller to __init__ from controller.py.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 20:57:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove explicit sudoers requirement.

Most of our build process runs as root and the overhead of explicitly
tracking sudo commands in the shipped sudoers.d file, plus the
operational overhead of keeping the sudoers.d file updated on build
hosts over time, is now considered to be unnecessary.
Instead, we now document that the build process will expect sudo
commands to work and the operator must make this happen (either by
running as root, via sudo -E, or allowing passwordless sudo for the
build user).

Change-Id: If2628e7d0c7efde0fb99c84a217523ba29b1b38d

commit_message:
Remove explicit sudoers requirement.

Most of our build process runs as root and the overhead of explicitly
tracking sudo commands in the shipped sudoers.d file, plus the
operational overhead of keeping the sudoers.d file updated on build
hosts over time, is now considered to be unnecessary.
Instead, we now document that the build process will expect sudo
commands to work and the operator must make this happen (either by
running as root, via sudo -E, or allowing passwordless sudo for the
build user).

Change-Id: If2628e7d0c7efde0fb99c84a217523ba29b1b38d

commit_message:
Document the dangers of co-existing elements.

Add a potent example (and simply remedy) of how element authors can
unwittingly conflict with each other in ways that it is almost
impossible for us to guard against with low level policy/mechanism in
di-b. Fixes bug 1181309.

Change-Id: I51e845065702911371e448521327143495c3b405

commit_message:
Check if local node has identity role before searching

this was causing the first chef run on an allinone server to fail.
will return the local node hash if the role exists locally, otherwise will search

Change-Id: I7db000223c68a7aaa3732125b31ac2282bb21cca

Os-collect-config minimally needs to be told what command to run. The
first time it runs it will detect the Heat and/or ec2 metadata change,
and run os-refresh-config, which will write out its configuration again.
After the command returns os-collect-config is expected to re-execute
itself to grab this configuration.

Change-Id: I3294e251a7a3373adb1e994eef7ada99aab8282a

Change-Id: I3294e251a7a3373adb1e994eef7ada99aab8282a
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 20:48:48.000000000', 'message': "Bootstrap os-collect-config on first boot

This may be perhaps the one time where we need to jump-start something
with first-boot.d. Since os-collect-config must be configured to run
properly long term with the desired command and such, we need to write
out its' configuration before running it for the first time. This only
ever must happen one time, after that it will write its own configuration.

Change-Id: I3294e251a7a3373adb1e994eef7ada99aab8282a

Change-Id: I3294e251a7a3373adb1e994eef7ada99aab8282a

commit_message:
Bootstrap os-collect-config during image build

Os-collect-config minimally needs to be told what command to run. The
first time it runs it will detect the Heat and/or ec2 metadata change,
and run os-refresh-config, which will write out its configuration again.
After the command returns os-collect-config is expected to re-execute
itself to grab this configuration.

Change-Id: I3294e251a7a3373adb1e994eef7ada99aab8282a

commit_message:
Purge serial console after grub is installed

If we do this during install, then configurations written during
finalise.d will overwrite our changes. We need this element to work
so we can address problems with serial console handling in raring
cloud images.

Change-Id: I0880a9609686215732a33c852b41cbc703a72521
Related-bug: #1208912

- http://logs.openstack.org/78/40478/1/check/gate-noop/41fecfd : SUCCESS in 0s

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 19:11:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove serial console so all console goes to tty0

While booting, some things require a working console. One of those
things is cloud-init. For whatever reason, ttyS0 being listed as the
last console causes problems with /dev/console usage in Ubuntu 13.04
(raring) that we did not see in 12.10 (quantal).

By using the remove-serial-console element in the seed configuration we
side-step this issue, leading to cloud-init running properly (and thus
generating ssh keys properly).

Fixes bug #1208912

Change-Id: Ic645f58923c869c881ec05b74aa0c822a32e81eb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove serial console so all console goes to tty0

While booting, some things require a working console. One of those
things is cloud-init. For whatever reason, ttyS0 being listed as the
last console causes problems with /dev/console usage in Ubuntu 13.04
(raring) that we did not see in 12.10 (quantal).

By using the remove-serial-console element in the seed configuration we
side-step this issue, leading to cloud-init running properly (and thus
generating ssh keys properly).

Fixes bug #1208912

Change-Id: Ic645f58923c869c881ec05b74aa0c822a32e81eb

commit_message:
DMTF CADF format

Adding support for the DMTF Cloud Audit (CADF) format which will be
used along with a generic notification filter to audit 'core'
component APIs.

initial code drop

blueprint support-standard-audit-formats

Change-Id: I3b27ceae8faa6427e4be1290c1406102e790e2e3

[{'created': '2013-08-06 19:54:47.000000000', 'message': "Ensure we return [node] if search returns nothing

If a node has not completed a chef-client run successfully,
it does not appear in the results of a Chef::Search call. This is
stupid, yes, but unfortunately that's the way it is. What we do in this
patch is look in the current node's runlist, and if the searched-for
recipe or role is in the current node's runlist, we return an array
with the node object, so that callers of search_for do not need to do things
like this:

 this = search_for that or node

Change-Id: I605ae1d3dd3543f50d1cf7f48d2995a434464cfa

like this:

 this = search_for that or node

Change-Id: I605ae1d3dd3543f50d1cf7f48d2995a434464cfa
"}, {'created': '2013-08-06 20:04:46.000000000', 'message': "Ensure we return [node] if search returns nothing

If a node has not completed a chef-client run successfully,
it does not appear in the results of a Chef::Search call. This is
stupid, yes, but unfortunately that's the way it is. What we do in this
patch is look in the current node's runlist, and if the searched-for
recipe or role is in the current node's runlist, we return an array
with the node object, so that callers of search_for do not need to do things
like this:

 this = search_for(that).first or node

Change-Id: I605ae1d3dd3543f50d1cf7f48d2995a434464cfa
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we return [node] if search returns nothing

If a node has not completed a chef-client run successfully,
it does not appear in the results of a Chef::Search call. This is
stupid, yes, but unfortunately that's the way it is. What we do in this
patch is look in the current node's runlist, and if the searched-for
recipe or role is in the current node's runlist, we return an array
with the node object, so that callers of search_for do not need to do things
like this:

 this = search_for(that).first or node

Change-Id: I605ae1d3dd3543f50d1cf7f48d2995a434464cfa

that's a good idea Julien.

i think once we can prove its value here in ceilometer (and beyond) it'd be smart to pull it into its own project."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-18 16:18:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-24 12:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(10 inline comments)

This code is using some unusual conventions.

The validation logic should be handled by the class constructors as much as possible, instead of relying on a separate method. This prevents a bad object from being created in the first place, and avoids an error if someone forgets to call the is_valid() method separately.

There are a lot of methods with names like set_Foo. Those can all be converted to property setters using @property and renaming the method for the name of the property. That way the code to set the property can just be "self.foo = new_value".

The patchset should include positive and negative tests for all of the validation assertions that are being made in the various classes.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-25 05:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 36.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-07-25 05:13:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35: (6 inline comments)

thanks for the comments Doug. 

coding style is definitely different... i asked the same questions when i first reviewed what Matt did and based on explanation i didn't know of an alternative way to impl.

in regards to the validation work. i think because we are ultimately defining 'events', the validation code will be triggered at that time. ie. you can create an invalid Attachment and never validate but if you ever add it to Event it will validate and fail at that point."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-25 05:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36: Works for me

commit_message:
DMTF CADF format (PLACEHOLDER for pycadf lib)

Adding support for the DMTF Cloud Audit (CADF) format which will be used
along with a generic notification filter to audit 'core' component APIs.

blueprint support-standard-audit-formats

Change-Id: I59b79e6a5b0bd8e748e122ddc5b210d9bd0ac426

commit_message:
Bump sphinx to the latest version

Looks like there is a problem with building docs on Sphinx 1.1.3
It should be investigated, but for now it's a good solution to it able
to build docs.

Fixes: bug #1206670

Change-Id: I448c734c29cb1fbec4bf9070ab1b0e8ed1dee269

commit_message:
Use CONF options instead of self.configuration.

Cause of change those options was moved out of the multibackend group.

Fix bug #1208964

Change-Id: Id14eba757845c8e5119d2b614ab0de417362a04d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 14:46:01.000000000', 'message': "Don't uninstall packages when on xenserver

It turns out our fix for package madness breaks when running on
xenserver. Put in a simple exclusion for that case until we figure out a
more total and systemic solution to everyone's problems.

Change-Id: I491917015337f83206937c53949a62aa63f4679f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't uninstall packages when on xenserver

It turns out our fix for package madness breaks when running on
xenserver. Put in a simple exclusion for that case until we figure out a
more total and systemic solution to everyone's problems.

Change-Id: I491917015337f83206937c53949a62aa63f4679f

[{'created': '2013-07-26 05:04:33.000000000', 'message': 'Increase test coverage of swift/common/db.py

The most low hanging fruit is _preallocate(). As it turns out,
we never excercise the calculations because we never give it
a file that exists.

Change-Id: I5df03aff295d2a1bca252a02b3985a6bc3eecb26
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 02:39:12.000000000', 'message': 'Increase test coverage of swift/common/db.py

The most low hanging fruit is _preallocate(). As it turns out,
we never excercise the calculations because we never give it
a file that exists.

This version uses mock.patch everywhere.

Change-Id: I5df03aff295d2a1bca252a02b3985a6bc3eecb26
'}]
commit_message:
Increase test coverage of swift/common/db.py

The most low hanging fruit is _preallocate(). As it turns out,
we never excercise the calculations because we never give it
a file that exists.

This version uses mock.patch everywhere.

Change-Id: I5df03aff295d2a1bca252a02b3985a6bc3eecb26

commit_message:
Provide cinder CLI man page.

Provide basic but hopefully useful man page.

shell.rst was merged into and replaced by the man page in HTML docs.

pbr is used to determine version.

Docs copyright was changed to more accurate "OpenStack Contributors".

Fixes: bug 1206968
Implements: blueprint clients-man-pages
Change-Id: Iedd7b4b161ced564833fd9433762b87a4c1a374d

[{'created': '2013-08-06 14:22:03.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid extra glance v2 locations call.

In 7df1c911 we added code to attempt to direct download
images from glance locations. This feature is meant to be off
by default however when it is disabled it adds an unnecessary
glance V2 API call.

This patch removes the extra get_locations call when
CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is empty (disabled). This effectively
fixes Nova on Python some 2.6 distros which fail to work with the
recent Glance V2 schema code.

Fixes LP Bug #1208656

Change-Id: I0989ed4f248cd1126d4703ad6498cfd66685ae31
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 15:21:45.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid extra glance v2 locations call!

In 7df1c911 we added code to attempt to direct download
images from glance locations. This feature is meant to be off
by default however when it is disabled it adds an unnecessary
glance V2 API call.

This patch removes the extra get_locations call when

fixes Nova on Python some 2.6 distros which fail to work with the

Change-Id: I0989ed4f248cd1126d4703ad6498cfd66685ae31

commit_message:
Avoid extra glance v2 locations call!

In 7df1c911 we added code to attempt to direct download
images from glance locations. This feature is meant to be off
by default however when it is disabled it adds an unnecessary
glance V2 API call.

This patch removes the extra get_locations call when
CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is empty (disabled). This effectively
fixes Nova on Python some 2.6 distros which fail to work with the
recent Glance V2 schema code.

Fixes LP Bug #1208656

Change-Id: I0989ed4f248cd1126d4703ad6498cfd66685ae31

commit_message:
Set the concurrent connections on the 3PAR array

Currently, the 3PAR backend has a limit to the number of concurrent
connections that can be made to the WS API Server. This patch is
setting this limit to 15 connections, the highest possible.

Change-Id: Ibb8618c2fc896e0164a5f6a151d6a870cd662527

Fixes bug 1174852

This fix changes the command being sent to the Nexus switch for
enabling a VLAN on an interface such that the 'add' keyword is
included only when there are prior VLANs already enabled on that
interface.

interface.

(cherry picked from commit - 92ef293d02a7499850bc3becda413d6be22ae06c)

Change-Id: I900e0cac9f88d38b5276a65bdfa7457aed466199
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Cisco nexus plugin failure for first VLAN on phy interface

Fixes bug 1174852

This fix changes the command being sent to the Nexus switch for
enabling a VLAN on an interface such that the 'add' keyword is
included only when there are prior VLANs already enabled on that
interface.

(cherry picked from commit - 92ef293d02a7499850bc3becda413d6be22ae06c)

Change-Id: I900e0cac9f88d38b5276a65bdfa7457aed466199

[{'created': '2013-07-18 02:06:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix auth issue in get_instance_host

_get_instance_host was attempting to use the
admin username and password with the user's
tenant, which leads to 401 auth errors from
Keystone when attempting to determine the
instance host from nova.

This patch reads the admin tenant from the same
place as the username and password and uses that
instead. It also removes the keystone call that
was used to determine the tenant_id from the name,
since that is no longer needed.

Change-Id: If7ab8df24f8a727b458a780af8909e4cc6e1d0eb
Fixes: bug 1202462
"}, {'created': '2013-07-18 02:26:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix auth issue in get_instance_host

Fixes: bug 1202462
"}]
commit_message:
Fix auth issue in get_instance_host

_get_instance_host was attempting to use the
admin username and password with the user's
tenant, which leads to 401 auth errors from
Keystone when attempting to determine the
instance host from nova.

This patch reads the admin tenant from the same
place as the username and password and uses that
instead. It also removes the keystone call that
was used to determine the tenant_id from the name,
since that is no longer needed.

DocImpact grizzly

Change-Id: If7ab8df24f8a727b458a780af8909e4cc6e1d0eb
Fixes: bug 1202462

commit_message:
Fix VMware Hyper can't honor hw_vif_model image property.

Support setting instance vif model through image property,
change default vif model to e1000. Available vif model options
for VMware Hyperv is "VirtualE1000, VirtualPCNet32, VirtualVmxnet".
Also this patch removes the unused list_interface method and tests.

DocImpact
Fix bug #1183192
Fix bug #1187251

Change-Id: I3a98bc26df7e2252bf043a71acbba2a158e213b8
(cherry picked from commit 088995fc2c792d6d029abd0e45d5c0cf09a5125a)

messages:

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/39/40139/1/check/gate-noop/080bc22 : SUCCESS in 0s
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-06 03:31:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure this is the right move for these templates. Some of them aren't even that different. Once normalized as both being yaml, the F18 template and its F17 counterpart are nearly identical. The diff is here:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/43267/

The difference is that the F18 one is using more advanced features _of heat_. The only OS level differences I see are paths to wordpress files. I think a smarter template would solve that with ln -sf and just be portable."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-08-06 18:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

F18 requires firewall-cmd operations.  I am leary of putting these in all the F17 images, as then they would need to be tested on F18.  The idea of this work is to ensure that what lands in a subdirectory works properly - eg F17 templates all work on F17 guests, F18 templates all work on F18.  This means duplicating alot of the templates with small changes, but that is ok - templates should be per distro.

This is the decision made at our last weekly Wednesday meeting.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-08-06 18:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

IRC discussion with sdake: CFN is not ready to make reusable separate config from resource definitions, so cfn really must be organized this way.'}, {'account_id': 3098, 'date': '2013-08-06 18:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Add F17, F18, F19, U12 subdirectories for templates

This change makes it possible for us to properly maintain example templates
for various distributions by organizing them into subdirectories.

Change-Id: I06e4d24cae83330af97870bab1e6795999218d1e

'}, {'created': '2013-08-05 17:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: we should retry glance upload on sigterm
