'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 10:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: retry when plugin killed by signal

Sometimes the glance upload will get killed because of a signal. We
should retry the upload on these types of errors.

It is currently unclear where the signal comes from, so further
investigation is required to determine why the signal gets raised. It
does not appear that any services are restarting at the time the signal
gets raised.

This change has also increased the coverage around the unit tests for
the glance upload, so we now test the try logic.

Fixes bug 1207746
Change-Id: I116be92e153cf27c353cb20168a67b2c0b3cd595
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: retry when plugin killed by signal

Sometimes the glance upload will get killed because of a signal. We
should retry the upload on these types of errors.

It is currently unclear where the signal comes from, so further
investigation is required to determine why the signal gets raised. It
does not appear that any services are restarting at the time the signal
gets raised.

This change has also increased the coverage around the unit tests for
the glance upload, so we now test the try logic.

Fixes bug 1207746
Change-Id: I116be92e153cf27c353cb20168a67b2c0b3cd595

commit_message:
Ensure the deleted column is not truncated

Currently, the deleted column get's a truncated UUID, this ensures the
column is set to the correct ID.

Fixes bug #1203929

Change-Id: Ia5701c2453c33e2507bd0c7e7fc3f1fdac6f4cca

commit_message:
Improve the L3 Agent support

New features:
- send_arp_for_ha
- periodic_interval
- periodic_fuzzy_delay

Fix bug #1207563

Partial Cherry-pick from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39836/

Change-Id: Ibc3d6574a203408e6f141e31e33b23f102acf343

commit_message:
Run Neutron migrations after creating schema

Partial-Bug 1207402

This patch executes Neutron DB migrations (based on alembic)
before starting the Neutron services, similar to what happens
for most of other openstack projects managed by devstack.
This will ensure devstack always creates correctly version-stamped
Neutron databases.

Change-Id: Ia941c426a1563bcc4cb5eae64ea30c0bf7677220

commit_message:
Update tempest test sample in devstack/README.md

As part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure, the scenario directory is added and
scenario tests are moved there. The tempest test sample should be updated
in README.md.

Fixes bug #1207109

Change-Id: I25067e4b42697985e8f4b808fad5eb801c805f9f

commit_message:
Add high availability tool for neutron networking

* Setup optional cron jobs to call the tool in order to find
offline l3 agents and migrate them to another online agent
* Supports a rebalance feature to shuffle tenants around
given the scheduler for neutron is very simplistic right now
* Supports rebalancing DHCP configuration to all DHCP agents

Change-Id: Iaf0686c2fa93ec1dcdd644b75cb3b4528d4cabf0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-28 19:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Support standalone api server

* Do not include main plugin in server recipe so that
we can support a standalone quantum api server.
* Fix ordering issues with openvswitch-agent install.
* Try to unify platform_options names across
distributions.

Change-Id: Ieb7c357baf882c9078dbdd577f53448af863c931
'}, {'created': '2013-07-30 23:28:55.000000000', 'message': 'Support standalone services

* Do not include main plugin in server recipe and
everywhere else, so that we can manage services
with roles on independent servers
* Support an independent quantum api server not running
any of the agents or packages required by plugin
* Fix ordering issues with openvswitch-agent install.
* Try to unify platform_options names across
distributions.
* Introduce a common.rb for setting up templates

commit_message:
Support standalone services

* Do not include main plugin in server recipe and
everywhere else, so that we can manage services
with roles on independent servers
* Support an independent quantum api server not running
any of the agents or packages required by plugin
* Fix ordering issues with openvswitch-agent install.
* Try to unify platform_options names across
distributions.
* Introduce a common.rb for setting up templates
required by nearly everything, like quantum.conf.
* Plugin recipes now serve to only install any
additional components required

Change-Id: Ieb7c357baf882c9078dbdd577f53448af863c931

Convert camelCase attribute naming to camel_case

Convert cases of camelCase attribute naming to camel_case in the
security groups V3 API to make the v3 API as whole consistent in the naming
of attributes

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

commit_message:
Implement v1 JSON Home Document

This patch introduces a JSON Home Document that enables users and api
clients to "follow their nose" in interacting with the Marconi
HTTP API. This is meant to be a baseline implementation, and as such
simply returns a hard-coded document.

Future iterations may include support for vendor-specific JSON and
dynamic, RBAC-aware home documents.

This patch anticipates the creation of http://docs.openstack-marconi.org

Implements: blueprint v1-api
Change-Id: Ie13e77fc220884bbb97aa988ddf2bc85076e37a1

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-23 05:41:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Wrt the separate config file ...

I'd prefer to try to avoid separate config files until we actually hit enough complexity that a separate file is warranted ... and even in the bittorrent case, it might just make sense for the use of external config to be limited to just the peers configuration

Looking at the Glance review, it doesn't look to me like anyone was strongly in favour of separate config files

Also, wrt using JSON ... https://twitter.com/jmason/status/359247350767697922 ... people complain about JSON config files almost as much as they complain about XML config files"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-23 05:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-23 08:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (11 inline comments)

Thanks so much for all the attention!  I am addressing these concerns and will have a new patch soon.  I have some questions in line and I am still not sure of the best configuration file options.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 19:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 23:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-08-06 15:15:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Couple of things about this patch:

1) It breaks Nova on Centos (python 2.6) due to its use of the Glance V2 API. There still seem to be some jsonschema/warlock issues there that haven't been tested yet. See this ticket: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1208656


2) It also adds an extra Glance v2 call to each image download request even when CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is disabled."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 00:31:59.000000000', 'message': "Add plug-in modules for direct downloads of glance locations.

Glance can expose direct URL locations to its clients.  In current
versions of nova the only URL that can be accessed directly is file://.
This patch adds a notion of download plug-ins.  With this new download
protocol modules can be added to without disruption to the rest of the
code base.  Based on the scheme of the URL returned from Glance a
plug-in will be loaded and used to download the data directly, instead
of first routing it through Glance.  If anything fails in the process
the image will be downloaded by way of Glance.

To add a new download handler one must create a file with a JSON
document in it.  The document must have the following:
{
    'scheme': <a string representing the scheme this plug-in handles>
              ex: 'file',
    'module': <a python module path to the download handler class>

    # the remaining entries are defined by the plug-ins specific needs
}
The path to this file is then added to the new option: download_modules.

Additionally, as part of the multiple-locations work in Glance meta data
comes back with each locations describing that location.  As an example,
this is needed for direct access to file URLs.  Nova cannot assume that
every file URL is accessible on its mounted file systems, nor can it
assume that the mount points are the same.  This patch solves that
problem for direct access to files.

docImpact
blueprint: image-multiple-location

Change-Id: I79b863c0075cebaadce5b630f22b81d2959ddbb1

"}, {'created': '2013-07-22 22:04:14.000000000', 'message': "Add plug-in modules for direct downloads of glance locations.

Glance can expose direct URL locations to its clients.  In current
versions of nova the only URL that can be accessed directly is file://.
This patch adds a notion of download plug-ins.  With this new download
protocol modules can be added without disruption to the rest of the
code base.  Based on the scheme of the URL returned from Glance a
plug-in will be loaded and used to download the data directly, instead
of first routing it through Glance.  If anything fails in the process
the image will be downloaded by way of Glance.

Handlers are loaded with stevedore.  To add a new module follow the example
in nova.image.downloads.file.py.  The module is required to have two
functions:

get_download_hander():
This must return a child of nova.image.download.TransferBase

get_scheme():
Return the URL scheme that this module handles (ex: 'file')

If additional configuration is needed it can be added by the specific
plug-in (as shown by file_download_module_config included with this
patch submission).  Once the module is created it must be added as an
entry point to the python installation.  For those included with nova
this can be done by adding the following it setup.cfg:

[entry_points]
nova.download.modules =
    file = nova.image.xfers.file

Additionally, as part of the multiple-locations work in Glance meta data
comes back with each location describing it.  As an example,
this is needed for direct access to file URLs.  Nova cannot assume that
every file URL is accessible on its mounted file systems, nor can it
assume that the mount points are the same.  This patch solves that
problem for direct access to files.

blueprint image-multiple-location

Change-Id: I79b863c0075cebaadce5b630f22b81d2959ddbb1

Change-Id: I79b863c0075cebaadce5b630f22b81d2959ddbb1

commit_message:
Add plug-in modules for direct downloads of glance locations

Glance can expose direct URL locations to its clients.  In current
versions of nova the only URL that can be accessed directly is file://.
This patch adds a notion of download plug-ins.  With this new download
protocol modules can be added without disruption to the rest of the
code base.  Based on the scheme of the URL returned from Glance a
plug-in will be loaded and used to download the data directly, instead
of first routing it through Glance.  If anything fails in the process
the image will be downloaded by way of Glance.

Handlers are loaded with stevedore.  To add a new module follow the example
in nova.image.downloads.file.py.  The module is required to have two
functions:

get_download_hander():
This must return a child of nova.image.download.TransferBase

get_scheme():
Return the URL scheme that this module handles (ex: 'file')

If additional configuration is needed it can be added by the specific
plug-in (as shown by file_download_module_config included with this
patch submission).  Once the module is created it must be added as an
entry point to the python installation.  For those included with nova
this can be done by adding the following it setup.cfg:

[entry_points]
nova.download.modules =
    file = nova.image.xfers.file

Additionally, as part of the multiple-locations work in Glance meta data
comes back with each location describing it.  As an example,
this is needed for direct access to file URLs.  Nova cannot assume that
every file URL is accessible on its mounted file systems, nor can it
assume that the mount points are the same.  This patch solves that
problem for direct access to files.

blueprint image-multiple-location

Change-Id: I79b863c0075cebaadce5b630f22b81d2959ddbb1

I would suggest changes like this are probably better done incrementally (i.e. one changeset/patch per guide/folder) to make them easier to review.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-02 15:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Stephen, I used the following command for this change:

for i in $(egrep -rl "[[:space:]]+$" * | grep '.xml'); do perl -pi -e 's/ +$//' $i; done

I think it's sufficient to validate that this command is working like expected. It just removes all trailing spaces in each line in each XML file.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-02 16:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Forgot to mention this one:

for i in $(egrep -rl "\t+$" * | grep '.xml'); do perl -pi -e 's/\t+$//g' $i; done

and tests.

things can wind up on the system and then everything breaks.

versions of setuptools and pip that ubuntu installed. Then re-install
pip and setuptools and virtualenv via pip just to be sure.

commit_message:
Update projects to global requirements before setup

We've agreed that we should be using global requirements, so
force projects to be updated to global requirements before we
test them.

Co-Authored-With: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

Change-Id: I0652f639673e600fd7508a9869ec85f8d5ce4518

This commit just removes an try except block from the aggregates
extension to see what the actual exception that is causing testr
parallel failures with tempest.

Change-Id: I38bb4a4c0a3bd9cab551886d12719848ec66b4eb
'}]
commit_message:
Do not merge test for race.

This commit just removes an try except block from the aggregates
extension to see what the actual exception that is causing testr
parallel failures with tempest.

Change-Id: I38bb4a4c0a3bd9cab551886d12719848ec66b4eb

[{'created': '2013-07-31 20:51:18.000000000', 'message': 'Sync up the default value for the network_for_ssh option

The code and tempest.conf.sample were using different defaults for the
network_for_ssh option. This patch makes tempest.conf.sample align with
the default in the code.

Fixes bug 1207082

Change-Id: Iac990b35f904259ef81a5b865d8b8be6e5c30822
'}]
commit_message:
Sync up the default value for the network_for_ssh option

The code and tempest.conf.sample were using different defaults for the
network_for_ssh option. This patch makes tempest.conf.sample align with
the default in the code.

Fixes bug 1207082

Change-Id: Iac990b35f904259ef81a5b865d8b8be6e5c30822

commit_message:
Import exceptions list is now configurable

List of import exceptions could be now specified in
hacking/import_exceptions option in tox.ini.

Fixes: bug #1206189

Change-Id: I3663c4798413f2142d50d9edf967af607d4af37f

commit_message:
python3: Fix tracebacks while running testsuites

Fix traceback while running testsuite, this is due
to the change between unicode and binary types in python3.

Change-Id: I6fd3eaca99022c7a5f096ae961dca41a3acafaee
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add the alarm id to the rest notifier body

This improves the recording of events from the client.
In the tests change the alarm to a string  to better match
what is actually returned (the alarm_id).

Change-Id: I4c577c3eafdadae20912dea2ff584a9e358b171c

commit_message:
Validate MS SQL database names according to the MSDN.

Namely, the first character must be one of the following:
* A letter as defined by the Unicode Standard 3.2. The Unicode definition
  of letters includes Latin characters from a through z, from A through Z,
  and also letter characters from other languages (restrict to latin).
* The underscore (_), at sign (@), or number sign (#). [Some additional
  considerations on @ and # skipped, we restrict to _).

Subsequent characters can include the following:
* Letters as defined in the Unicode Standard 3.2 (restrict to latin).
* Decimal numbers from either Basic Latin or other national scripts
  (restrict to 0-9).
* The at sign, dollar sign ($), number sign, or underscore.

See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms175874%28v=sql.100%29.aspx

Change-Id: I99f1798e261002d5ec22f2e7d10b1e29ef2ad81f

[{'created': '2013-07-22 19:54:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow user and admin lock of an instance

The existing instance lock capability is currently restricted
to being an admin-only action in the default policy. This
introduces additional functionality that allows the lock to be
used by users (to prevent accidental changes to an instance for
example), but also allows the lock to taken by an administrator
with appropriate privileges such that it overrides any lock held
by the user (for example to block actions on a rouge instance).

When unlocking an instance, an additional check is made to see if
the lock is held by the owner of the instance. If it isn't, an
additional check is made against the unlock_override policy.

Blueprint mandatory-vm-lock

commit_message:
Allow user and admin lock of an instance

The existing instance lock capability is currently restricted
to being an admin-only action in the default policy. This
introduces additional functionality that allows the lock to be
used by users (to prevent accidental changes to an instance for
example), but also allows the lock to taken by an administrator
with appropriate privileges such that it overrides any lock held
by the user (for example to block actions on a rouge instance).

When unlocking an instance, an additional check is made to see if
the lock is held by user. If it isn't, an additional check is
made against the unlock_override policy.

Additionally added the current instance lock status to the
v3 extended status extension.

Blueprint mandatory-vm-lock
Flags: DocImpact

Change-Id: I5040276c2d9fd42a71c9d8d4529331992abd7538

commit_message:
Moved download logic from GlanceImageService to loaders

Currently we can download image either by http/https or directly from filesystem.
In future this can be extended by other ways of direct image downloading.
The logic of choosing way to download image is concentrated in download method
of GlanceImageService.

Implemented get_loader method of GlanceImageService class
which returns proper loader depending on set flags and image location scheme.

Implemented HttpImageLoader, FilesystemImageLoader classes
that provide download logic.

Moved functions from nova.image.glance to nova.image.utils.

Change-Id: I4be5facf7fd58fc840f45bda83d0702513b8f56e
Implements: blueprint divide-download-image-logic

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 14:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/12/39712/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/c8c3bcb : SUCCESS in 24m 21s
'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-08-01 20:43:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,

thanks again for the attention to detail.

However, I believe that we should address readability issues in the template/html/tooling. The docbook tags have semantic meaning and if we change to use literal rather than emphasis, if we update the template/html/tooling we could make these sections less readable in the future.

Shall we start a discussion on the mailing list ?"}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-02 05:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Tom: I think a discussion on the mailing list would be the best.'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Pretty much "what Tom said".'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-08-06 09:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Abandoned like discussed on the mailinglist.'}]

When I was adding a field to the notification I noticed that

only use mock instead of a combination of mox and mock.

Change-Id: I507388b38728f6bd5417817e70890c1e966912c4

commit_message:
fix alarm notifier tests

When I was adding a field to the notification I noticed that
the change was not getting caught. This changes the mocking to
only use mock instead of a combination of mox and mock.

commit_message:
Sync gettextutils from oslo

The oslo changes necessary for delayed translation were refactored in
oslo. This patch set brings in the refactored changes, implemented
under the same change-id mentioned below.

Partially implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I27640a3c8b255be51bc6396d238098bd25af61ec

commit_message:
Update-ServiceConfig function added.

Function to change credential for service added.
Appropriate call for it from Execution Plan added.

Change-Id: Iaf7c6e135550aec6147fe9ea899f2d013b8912f5

commit_message:
Add missing exceptions for per user quota

There was missing exceptions QuotaExists and ProjectUserQuotaNotFound

Rename message format property from `message' to `msg_fmt' in QuotaException

Change-Id: I93f621fae342e78280bf50eebf5b0bca9d281ed3

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-22 00:26:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am really not a fan of periodic tasks. I am trying really hard to kill our need on them by using Ceilometer for alarms (the only other need for periodic tasks atm). This is going to make scaling more difficult. I'd rather integrate with an external service to provide timed job management or just fix up the error handling."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Unfortunately the existence of periodic tasks is effectively a blocker to implementing the architecture to scale heat-engine out. As Angus mentioned, we have a plan to get rid of the existing one and we don't want to add any more."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the comments. 
Actually, I don't like adding a periodic task either. The problem is that when instance deletion failed, the error handing code cannot keep trying the deletion forever. We don't want to block possible further adjustment. "integrate with an external service to provide timed job management" sounds good I think.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

And I have thought about having the clean_up triggered each time adjustment happens, which would make the patch much easy since there would be no race condition to worry about. But that would leave orphaned instances there for a long time if the load of the instance group remains stable - no adjustment happens.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:55:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMHO this whole approach is flawed - we should just move InstanceGroup to be a nested stack, as is planned for h3:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/instance-group-nested-stack

Then if an instance fails to create, we still track it as a resource in failed state inside the InstanceGroup nested stack, and we can try to delete it on stack delete."}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-07-22 16:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Agree. better to leave this to instance-group-nested-stack.'}, {'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-06 08:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

testing 

# one
# two'}]

commit_message:
Add a periodic task to clean up orphaned instances

Use the resource_data table to store orphaned instance names, and
delete them in a periodic task.

The change to heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py is to overcome the potential
race condition between the greenthread that puts the orphaned instance
into resource_data table and the one forked off from the periodic
task to remove orphaned instances.

Fixes bug #1192554

Change-Id: If5e0a1faf72efe6c974c5bd96fcd8defe58af1c1

I just want to say. The change is really functionally inconsequential to the code, and it will just be a time saver for people who can from eclipse simply clone the project, and have those two files getting in the way. 

It was mentioned here that the changes should go in the user's global settings, but what if there are projects for which those files are relevant. Besides, why ask everybody to do something that can be done once here (again, inconsequentially). 

This change has been in nova for quite a while, it is in heat, it got approved in less than 24 hours in oslo.config. 

It really is only about making developers' lifes easier. Again, without functional consequence, I don't see why it is getting particularly hash reviews here."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-07-19 18:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have no problem with this, and sure you can put it in the global file but then you also have to run git config in said repo every time to have it picked up properly.

Let the needless debate begin :)'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-07-21 11:13:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

OK I'll take off the big scary red X.  I think that files not directly related to the project shouldn't be in its .gitignore.  I don't object THAT strongly to this particular addition, but wouldn't want to start a trend.  If enough people are OK with this, I won't lose sleep over it getting merged.  Please though add a comment to the file so it's under a new section ('environment'?), and remove the 'yuck' from the commit message - not everyone hates Eclipse :)"}, {'account_id': 7708, 'date': '2013-07-22 12:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Add eclipse project files to .gitignore

Like some of the other projects (nova, heat, oslo) git ignore eclipse
project files. This will remove manual steps for people developing from
eclipse.

Change-Id: Ib908c8d419072b440f5ec647bea8f13b97e48f7c

commit_message:
Add periodic task to check whether volume is stuck in creating

If a volume gets stuck in creating state there is no way to delete.
We should have creating timeout to handle this case.
If it's in creating state for longer than 'volume_create_timeout' then set it
to error

fix bug 1204695

Change-Id: I66bc72ee83b7b70eda214e268ba3c9eb7fa28610

commit_message:
Add bin directory to flake8 when not in venv

If doing run_tests.sh -N -p we only check cinder*
This patch adds a directive to also check the files
in bin/

Change-Id: Ia68073e16067df978475db058c9c0693f35df81c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 07:09:02.000000000', 'message': "Ignore H checks from flake8

Until we've resolved the disconnect between consensus and the upstream
hacking project I'm not comfortable following it's H* rules blindly.
We could just blacklist H803, but so far there is no evidence that any
other new rules will have consensus around them, and we actually have
code to write.

Change-Id: I50f3d545f694827507ffd238f41a38c0b12e3a59
"}, {'created': '2013-08-06 07:09:02.000000000', 'message': "Ignore H803 checks from flake8

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it.

Change-Id: I50f3d545f694827507ffd238f41a38c0b12e3a59
"}, {'created': '2013-08-06 07:09:02.000000000', 'message': "Ignore H803 checks from flake8

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it.

Change-Id: I50f3d545f694827507ffd238f41a38c0b12e3a59
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore H803 checks from flake8

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it.

Change-Id: I50f3d545f694827507ffd238f41a38c0b12e3a59

commit_message:
Remove cinder.exception from Brick

This patch fixes an issue that made
Brick's connector module dependent on cinder's
exception module.

Adds a new brick exceptions module to store brick
wide exceptions.

fixes bug #1206288

Change-Id: I070d08f07c7bc488b24b0d68531bb2e0a5461422

subject: Allow to clear IP address of a port
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-13 11:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/1/check/gate-neutron-pep8/374 : SUCCESS in 1m 59s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36935/1/check/gate-neutron-docs/374/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/1/check/gate-neutron-python26/358 : FAILURE in 21m 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/1/check/gate-neutron-python27/374 : FAILURE in 15m 02s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3257 : SUCCESS in 17m 52s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-13 22:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The behaviour of the nicira plugin is to enforce IP spoof prevention by default; the underlying NVP platform requires IP spoof prevention to enforce security groups; without an IP, IP spoof prevention would be disabled, which is not possible because of the security group.

The firewall agent instead just remove the IP spoof rules, and keep the security group intact. Whether this is correct or not, it is beyond the scope of this discussion.

The easiest shortcut is to override the test in the nicira plugin to create a network with IP spoof disabled.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-14 01:24:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This has come up on this list before.  Why are creating a 2nd way to specify no ips for a port.  The API should accept an empty list on an update."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-14 01:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

markmacclain:
host_routes, dnsnameservers are all accepting None as valid input, API will convert None to List.
In addition, nicira plugin even does not support [] as port update.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-14 01:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-14 02:03:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/2/check/gate-neutron-pep8/398 : SUCCESS in 2m 01s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36935/2/check/gate-neutron-docs/398/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 43s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/2/check/gate-neutron-python26/382 : FAILURE in 21m 35s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/2/check/gate-neutron-python27/398 : FAILURE in 14m 58s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3348 : SUCCESS in 17m 06s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-14 04:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

test_update_port_update_ips_empty shows us that:
the input [] of fixed_ips does not work either.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-14 11:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

the nicira plugin does not allow to reset ips on a port where the security groups are configured, which is different from not accepting an empty list or None as input to update port operation.

The security group is bound to the port as this is the default policy enforced by the nicira plugin, which gets triggered when the port is created.
To override the default logic, and make the test work similarly to the other plugins, you will need to override the test in the nicira plugin. I will do that for you, if you prefer.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-14 12:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-07-14 12:30:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Salvatore Orlando,
I think ovs plugin creates default SG once port is created, however, it allows to clear the fixed-ips.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-14 12:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36935/3/check/gate-neutron-pep8/405 : SUCCESS in 1m 54s

commit_message:
Set use_ipv6=False as default for IptablesFirewallDriver

The default configuration "use_ipv6=True" in
IptablesFirewallDriver cause the error when
some OS releases prevent(blacklist) ipv6 module

Fixes bug #1203611

Change-Id: I1c8c8653875c76929ba2fdadb0cd580681101375

commit_message:
Add Babel missing requirement

Babel is required by heat.openstack.common.gettextutils but was only in
test-requirements.txt.

Fixes bug #1208673

Change-Id: Iaffcbc861e64caa37d64335f0fb6e568672ffc52

commit_message:
Adding volume size to the backup views/models.

* Save the size of the guest before running a backup
* Display the size in the backup GET/LIST views
* Simplify the dbaas module removing redundant class.
* Switch get_filesystem_volume_stats to use os.statvfs()
* Change output of volume stats to return used in GB
  to simplify various view that display it.

Implements: Blueprint backup-volume-size

Change-Id: I860427d3491acb34e43ee23f91e4ffbb39e0042c

commit_message:
Package with pbr

Uses pbr-0.5.20 glob support to install elements.

This packaging will facilitate tripleo-image-elements being
consumed by CI tooling, enabling tests which require customized
images.

Change-Id: Id0ce2f9954f487ef2375e51cc8287999b82396f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 03:59:37.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix hacking errors"

This reverts commit 6b74b65449a45f90f187f0157e3c7b9d6a9d0b92.

The upstream hacking project is problematic at the moment, and until
thats resolved I'm not comfortable following it's H* rules blindly. We
could just blacklist H803, but so far there is no evidence that any
other new rules will have consensus around them, and we actually have
code to write.

Change-Id: I8eea9eb2562e12136018e762c8a5e23527fcf48f
'}, {'created': '2013-08-06 03:59:37.000000000', 'message': "Blacklist H803

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it to avoid
breaking folk's muscle memory.

Change-Id: I8eea9eb2562e12136018e762c8a5e23527fcf48f
"}, {'created': '2013-08-06 03:59:37.000000000', 'message': "Blacklist H803

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it to avoid
breaking folk's muscle memory.

Change-Id: I8eea9eb2562e12136018e762c8a5e23527fcf48f
"}]
commit_message:
Blacklist H803

H803 isn't supported by community consensus. Blacklist it to avoid
breaking folk's muscle memory.

Change-Id: I8eea9eb2562e12136018e762c8a5e23527fcf48f

commit_message:
remove swift dependency of s3 middleware

In middleware/s3_token.py, here only use swift for a logger and path
split functionality. We should remove swift dependency by using new
codes.

fixes bug #1178738

Change-Id: Icc2648720e220a873d1fb8e9961d777ceabef70b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 01:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'Reload os-collect-config in post-configure.d

Note that we specifically want to send a SIGHUP only, which will cause
os-collect-config to re-execute itself. That will pick up any changes
to its configuration or os-collect-config itself. We cannot stop it in
an os-refresh-config script, because that would likely end up
terminating os-refresh-config.

Change-Id: I5da877d4297c43fb7909542962a43cc4d5295b4a
'}]
commit_message:
Reload os-collect-config in post-configure.d

Note that we specifically want to send a SIGHUP only, which will cause
os-collect-config to re-execute itself. That will pick up any changes
to its configuration or os-collect-config itself. We cannot stop it in
an os-refresh-config script, because that would likely end up
terminating os-refresh-config.

Change-Id: I5da877d4297c43fb7909542962a43cc4d5295b4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 00:51:09.000000000', 'message': "Ignore H checks from flake8

Until we've resolved the disconnect between consensus and the upstream
hacking project I'm not comfortable following it's H* rules blindly.
We could just blacklist H803, but so far there is no evidence that any
other new rules will have consensus around them, and we actually have
code to write.

Change-Id: Ie01e799d5e8ba176f5198fb9b6629a98027fc66c
"}, {'created': '2013-08-06 00:51:09.000000000', 'message': "Ignore H803 checks from flake8

H803 isn't supported by community consensus - blacklist it to avoid
breaking folks muscle memory.

Change-Id: Ie01e799d5e8ba176f5198fb9b6629a98027fc66c
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore H803 checks from flake8

H803 isn't supported by community consensus - blacklist it to avoid
breaking folks muscle memory.

Change-Id: Ie01e799d5e8ba176f5198fb9b6629a98027fc66c

commit_message:
Replace deprecated :rubygems source

Fix deprecation warnings thrown by bundler:

  The source :rubygems is deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure.
  Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible,
  or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

Change-Id: I63d0497d96a210ac9b6e01a9f0bd4fb4b4f14d9f

commit_message:
Rename: VALUES to ALLOWED_VALUES, PATTERN to ALLOWED_PATTERN

Rename VALUES to ALLOWED_VALUES, PATTERN to ALLOWED_PATTERN in
parameters and modify related references in other modules

Implements blueprint hot-parameters

Change-Id: Iad018f6a9fc1166aa2c5d94720faf997dc7e98a3

commit_message:
Change token name from context.

Remove password auth from pyrax to conform with
the changes going through the engine regarding
not using a password. Previous commit was an
incorrect branch with a bug.

blueprint pyrax-token-auth

Change-Id: I47cd00199133b88a2343b12c847635c726452629

commit_message:
Use flake8 for pep8 check

This change also makes tox.ini and test-requirements.txt
align with what is found in diskimage-builder.
Change-Id: I0899c746ec82c9af665efc03c4d372b8cd38153d

commit_message:
auth_uri (public ep) should not default to auth_* values (admin ep)

Fixes bug 1207517 by logging a warning when auth_uri (which should point
to the public identity endpoint) falls back on auth_* values (which
should point to the admin identity endpoint).

Change-Id: I2b051ae10197206f6954672f22e5bff32e3f6c2a

The keystone_authtoken config options defined in
keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py didn't have help strings.

introspection.

Fixes Bug1159039

commit_message:
Adds help in keystone_authtoken config opts

The keystone_authtoken config options defined in
keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py didn't have help strings.
Without help, we couldn't generate documented config files via
introspection.

Fixes Bug1159039

Change-Id: I6d805432edf65db8161d6a6f4916185c4df6bb90

commit_message:
Add obj_attr_is_set() method to NovaObject

We have lots of places where we need to test if an object's attribute
has been set yet, and we do that rather manually. This adds a
method to the base object to make that more convienient and consistent.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: Ic5ff4a80b10dec6a5a772c21405de7ff1d331e72

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-22 22:09:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add ObjectActionFailed exception and make Instance use it

The obj_load_attr() code in Instance slipped through review with
just a "raise Exception()" for the case where the load cannot
complete. This adds a new exception for the case, fixes the
Instance.obj_load_attr() method, and adds a test to verify it.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I73c966deb3c498019370eb83ade64bff2c48aec0

commit_message:
Add ObjectActionFailed exception and make Instance use it

The obj_load_attr() code in Instance slipped through review with
just a "raise Exception()" for the case where the load cannot
complete. This adds a new exception for the case, fixes the
Instance.obj_load_attr() method, and adds a test to verify it.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I73c966deb3c498019370eb83ade64bff2c48aec0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-22 22:09:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix change detection logic in conductor

The change detection logic in conductor attempts to determine what
changes an object action had on the object itself in order to
communicate them back to the caller. This logic previously assumed
that if an attribute was present on the updated object that it was
also present on the original. However, that will not be the case
in situations where a method sets a new attribute (such as
instance create, which will set many of them).

This change to the logic avoids triggering a lazy-load of the
attribute on the original object while trying to determine if
it has changed. It corrects behavior and doesn't change the interface
at all, so no RPC version changes are needed.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I8b01185ba81f3126f494db95c70c23dfa77ad959

commit_message:
Fix change detection logic in conductor

The change detection logic in conductor attempts to determine what
changes an object action had on the object itself in order to
communicate them back to the caller. This logic previously assumed
that if an attribute was present on the updated object that it was
also present on the original. However, that will not be the case
in situations where a method sets a new attribute (such as
instance create, which will set many of them).

This change to the logic avoids triggering a lazy-load of the
attribute on the original object while trying to determine if
it has changed. It corrects behavior and doesn't change the interface
at all, so no RPC version changes are needed.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I8b01185ba81f3126f494db95c70c23dfa77ad959

commit_message:
Convert pause/unpause to use objects

Switch pause/unpause to use objects.  This also converts the compute API
tests to be unit tests.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I439e06e7c9778b18e8a736dcbc76db534bcdb835
